item.title: ‘Fauda’ crew member ‘killed in action’ amid Israel-Hamas conflict
item.description: Master Sgt. (res.) Matan Meir, a television producer known for his work on the Netflix drama Fauda, was killed in a blast from a booby-trapped tunnel shaft in Gaza. Meir was killed during the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas. Israel has increased its ground offensive and air strikes in retaliation for Hamas' attack on southern areas. Meir was an integral part of the Fauda crew and his death has left the cast and crew devastated. The show has faced criticism for its portrayal of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The conflict has resulted in the deaths of over 1,200 people on the Israeli side and over 11,000 Palestinians, according to the Health Ministry in Gaza.

item.title: I would be in-authentic if I say there won’t be any pressure of semi-final: Dravid
item.description: India head coach Rahul Dravid acknowledges that the World Cup semi-final against New Zealand will be a high-pressure game, despite their strong performance in the league stage. He emphasizes that there are no guarantees in cricket and the team can only prepare to the best of their abilities. Dravid also jokes about the criticism that may arise after a single loss. He praises Shreyas Iyer for his consistent performance in the middle order, highlighting the difficulty India has faced in finding a reliable number four batsman in the past decade.

item.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor celebrate first Diwali with daughter Raha
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor, a Bollywood couple, celebrated their first Diwali with their daughter Raha. Alia shared pictures on Instagram showcasing their celebrations, including Ranbir kissing her and Raha's customized dupatta. The couple tied the knot in April 2022 and welcomed their daughter in November last year. They recently celebrated Raha's first birthday with a bash at their Mumbai residence. Alia will be seen in the film "Jigra," while Ranbir will star in the action thriller "Animal." The film also features Anil Kapoor, Bobby Deol, and Rashmika Mandanna and is set to release on December 1.

item.title: Pakistan: China announces Khunjerab Pass closure for four months in winter
item.description: The Chinese government has announced the closure of Khunjerab Pass, the only place connecting China and Pakistan over a mountainous range, for four months in winter. This comes almost a month after an agreement was made to keep the high-altitude road open throughout the year. The closure will be from December to March, and the pass will adopt a seasonal mode of customs clearance during this time. The closure is due to excessive snowfall, which has already covered the road with up to six inches of snow. Travelers have complained about the lack of authorities present to clear the road for traffic.

item.title: UK PM Sunak hosts Jaishankar at Downing Street for Diwali tea
item.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and his wife Akshata Murty hosted Indian External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and his wife Kyoko Jaishankar for Diwali tea at Downing Street in London. Jaishankar's visit aims to review various aspects of bilateral ties and strengthen the friendly relationship between India and the UK. The two countries have been negotiating a free trade agreement and hope to finalize it before the 2024 general elections in both countries. The visit will include meetings with UK Foreign Secretary James Cleverly and other dignitaries, as well as attending events and addressing a Diwali reception.

item.title: French President tells Israeli President he never accused Israel of harming innocent civilians
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron called Israeli President Isaac Herzog to clarify comments he made during an interview with the BBC. Macron stated that he never intended to accuse Israel of intentionally harming innocent civilians in their campaign against Hamas. He expressed his support for Israel's right to self-defense and their war against Hamas. Macron clarified that his comments were in reference to the humanitarian situation in Gaza and the importance of finding and delivering humanitarian solutions. President Herzog acknowledged Macron's clarification and reiterated that Israel acts in accordance with international law and takes measures to prevent harm to uninvolved civilians. The responsibility for harm caused to innocent people in Gaza rests with Hamas.

item.title: UAE: CBUAE enhances Emiratisation efforts in financial sector through its participation in Tawdheef
item.description: The Central Bank of the UAE (CBUAE) will participate in the 17th annual Tawdheef exhibition from November 13-15. The purpose of the exhibition is to provide UAE nationals with job opportunities in the banking and insurance sectors as part of the country's Emiratisation agenda. The CBUAE will showcase its positive work culture and attractive environment at the exhibition, as well as educate attendees on its regulatory and supervisory role and financial inclusion efforts. The CBUAE aims to advance its Emiratisation efforts by employing and training UAE national graduates through programs like "Ethraa" and reaching specific Emiratisation rates in different sectors. The Chief Human Resources Officer of the CBUAE emphasized the bank's commitment to training and employing UAE nationals and attracting skilled professionals to contribute to its development.

item.title: Hezbollah reportedly reinforcing personnel in Lebanon
item.description: Hezbollah has reportedly transferred 1,500 of its personnel from Syria to Lebanon while their positions in Syria have been taken over by Iranian-backed Iraqi and Afghan militias. Hezbollah recently claimed responsibility for firing a guided anti-tank rocket near Moshav Dovev in Israel, injuring employees of the Israel Electric Corporation who were repairing power lines damaged in previous fire from Lebanon. Hezbollah alleged that the victims were installing surveillance equipment near the border.Hezbollah has reportedly transferred 1,500 personnel from Syria to Lebanon, with their positions being filled by Iranian-backed Iraqi and Afghan militias. Hezbollah has taken responsibility for firing a guided anti-tank rocket in the area of Moshav Dovev, injuring several employees of the Israel Electric Corporation. The electric company claims their employees were repairing power lines damaged in previous fire from Lebanon, while Hezbollah says the victims were installing surveillance equipment near the border.

item.title: Trudeau trying to manage damage he inflicted: Experts on fresh claims by Canadian PM amid diplomatic row
item.description: The article discusses the diplomatic standoff between India and Canada, sparked by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's allegations of Indian involvement in the killing of Sikh separatist leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar. Foreign affairs analysts criticize Trudeau for making these accusations before the investigation is complete, emphasizing that it was Canada that first expelled an Indian diplomat. They argue that reciprocity is expected in diplomacy and India will likely retaliate. The article also mentions India's support for a resolution against Israeli settlements in the West Bank, which strategic experts view as a principled stance. Trudeau accuses India of violating the Vienna Convention, but former diplomats assert that the host country has the authority to determine the number of diplomats. The article concludes by mentioning previous tensions between the two countries, including Canada's withdrawal of diplomats and India seeking diplomatic parity.

item.title: Ban on firecrackers flouted in Delhi despite SC order
item.description: Despite a ban on firecrackers, people in several areas of Delhi violated the rules and celebrated Diwali by bursting them. Firecrackers were seen being burst in Shahpur Jat and Hauz Khas areas, with gatherings in parks for this purpose. The intensity of firecracker usage was lower compared to last year, but environmentalist Bhavreen Kandhari reported that firecrackers were also burst in her residential area, Defence Colony, despite complaints to the police. The lack of enforcement has raised questions about the effectiveness of the ban. In some areas, such as Greater Kailash and Chittaranjan Park, there was less firecracker activity until later in the evening after the puja rituals. However, violations of the ban were observed in other parts of the city, including South Delhi and East of Kailash, where shopkeepers sold small firecrackers to children. While the intensity of firecracker usage was reportedly lower than last year, it still caused concerns about air pollution.

item.title: Why Diwali isn’t as big in Bollywood films as Holi, Karwa Chauth are
item.description: The article discusses the portrayal of Diwali, Holi, and Karwa Chauth festivals in Bollywood movies. It highlights how Diwali, once a significant plot point in movies like Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham and Vaastav: The Reality, has gradually disappeared from the big screen. In contrast, Holi has become Bollywood's favorite festival, often depicted with suggestive lyrics and the glorification of harassment. Karwa Chauth, a traditional festival centered around devotional love, has also gained prominence in Bollywood movies. The article suggests that it is time for Diwali to make a comeback in Bollywood and calls for more diverse and respectful portrayals of festivals in films.

item.title: Diwali: Jaipur-based organisation makes 3 lakh ‘diyas’ using cow dung
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Shri Krishna Balram Gau Seva Trust in Jaipur, India, made over 300,000 lamps using cow dung for Diwali. The dung was sourced from the Hingonia Gaushala, a facility managed by the trust. Volunteers mixed the dung with flour, wood powder, and gum guar powder to create the lamps, which can also be used as fertilizers. Most of the lamps were distributed among followers, while some were sold in the market. The initiative aimed to promote cow protection.

item.title: Justice (retd.) Hussain appointed as caretaker CM of Pakistan’s Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa
item.description: Justice (retd.) Arshad Hussain has been appointed as the interim chief minister of Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province after the previous caretaker chief minister, Muhammad Azam Khan, passed away. Hussain, who previously served as the law minister and chief justice of the Supreme Appellate Court of Gilgit Baltistan, was selected as the consensus candidate during a meeting convened by Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Governor Haji Ghulam Ali. The appointment follows the dissolution of the provincial assemblies earlier this year and is part of Pakistan's preparations for upcoming general elections.

PM Modi had recently addressed a rally organized by the Madiga Reservation Porata Samithi, where he pledged to establish a committee to address the demands for SC categorization. item.title: Fire at multiplex in Surat; 2 fire personnel injured while dousing blaze
item.description: A fire broke out in a commercial building in Surat, Gujarat, at a multiplex on Sunday morning. The incident resulted in the destruction of a screen and several chairs, but there were no reported casualties as the theater was closed at the time. Two fire personnel sustained minor injuries during the operation to control the blaze, which took around two-and-a-half hours to bring under control. Suspected to have been caused by a short-circuit, the fire occurred in one of the seven screens of Time Cinema multiplex located on the fourth floor of Fortune Mall in Pal locality. Despite the damage to the screen and chairs, the fire did not spread to other parts of the multiplex.

item.title: Russia opens terrorist investigation after freight train derailed
item.description: Russian investigators have launched a terrorism investigation following the derailment of a major freight train in the Ryazan region. The investigative committee stated that the incident was caused by a homemade bomb that exploded on the railway line at 07:12 on November 11, 2023, resulting in the derailment of 19 wagons. The explosion occurred at 07:12 on November 11, 2023, resulting in 19 wagons being derailed.

item.title: Kumaraswamy hits out at Congress CM Siddaramaiah for making tall promises in Telangana
item.description: JD(S) Karnataka President H D Kumaraswamy criticized Chief Minister Siddaramaiah for failing to fulfill key election promises in Karnataka while making grand promises in Telangana. Kumaraswamy called Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar "Temporary Chief Minister" and "Duplicate Chief Minister," respectively, mocking their campaign in Telangana. He pointed out that they promised five hours of power to farmers in Telangana, even though the state already provided 24-hour power supply. Kumaraswamy also highlighted the large number of vacant posts in Karnataka and accused Siddaramaiah and his deputy of promising to fill two lakh posts in Telangana. He mentioned the shortage of agriculture officers and personnel in his own constituency and criticized the lack of buses and staff for the Shakti scheme. Kumaraswamy questioned why the Congress had not given Rs 4,000 to women heads of families in Karnataka while promising it in Telangana. He further claimed that there was frequent load shedding despite the Gruha Jyothi scheme offering free electricity.

He spent a significant portion of his life in exile due to his family's status as targets of the Communist regime. Schwarzenberg played a crucial role in the Velvet Revolution and later became a senator and helped establish the TOP09 party. Despite running for president in 2013, he lost to Milos Zeman.

item.title: Researchers reveal genetics of near healthy tissue help detect lung cancer’s return
item.description: New research led by NYU Langone Health and its Perlmutter Cancer Centre suggests that genetic data from healthy tissue near lung tumors may be a better predictor of cancer recurrence than analyzing the tumors themselves. The study, which focused on lung adenocarcinoma, found that analyzing the transcriptome of apparently healthy tissue accurately predicted recurrence 83% of the time, compared to 63% when analyzing tumor tissue. The study also revealed that genes associated with inflammation in adjacent healthy tissue were particularly useful for making predictions. The findings suggest that immunotherapy could be used to combat tumor growth before it becomes detectable by traditional methods. The researchers plan to use their findings to assess recurrence risk in newly treated lung cancer patients.

item.title: Lynda Carter shares how her husband Robert Altman’s death inspired new song ‘Rise Up’
item.description: American actress and singer Lynda Carter appeared on 'The Tamron Hall Show' where she discussed her new single 'Rise Up'. Carter revealed that the track was partially inspired by her late husband, Robert Altman, who passed away in February 2021 from myelofibrosis. She also mentioned that her daughter, Jessica Carter Altman, who is also a musician, had encouraged her to start writing again following her husband's death. The article mentions that 'Rise Up' is a song about social advocacy and that Carter wants it to ignite the activist spirit in listeners. She believes that when people come together, their voices are amplified, and change becomes inevitable.

The court upheld a previous judgment by the Allahabad High Court, which stated that a person who resorts to violence and does not value human life has no right to special protection from the state.

item.title: India safe as long as its brave soldiers stand guard at borders: Modi to security forces on Diwali
item.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed soldiers stationed near the border and highlighted India's growing capabilities in the defense sector. He emphasized the importance of protecting India's borders and maintaining peace in the country. Modi expressed his gratitude to the soldiers for their commitment to duty, especially during festivals like Diwali when they are away from their families. He praised the bravery and sacrifices of India's security forces, stating that they are the strongest wall at the borders. Modi also mentioned India's achievements in various fields, including space exploration, sports, and economic growth. He acknowledged that India is now fulfilling the needs of its friends and allies, becoming a significant global player in the defense sector. Modi concluded by expressing his deep emotion and pride in spending Diwali with the security forces.

item.title: Century stand by Rohit-Gill pair as India score 119/1 in 15 overs
item.description: In their final World Cup league game against the Netherlands, India got off to a strong start, reaching 119 for 1 after 15 overs. Shubman Gill scored a quick-fire half-century, scoring 51 off 32 balls and adding 100 for the opening stand with captain Rohit Sharma (60 batting off 48 balls). This is the third time in the tournament that India has crossed the 90-run mark in the first powerplay. Rohit Sharma also broke the record for hitting the most sixes in a calendar year, surpassing AB de Villiers' previous record of 58 maximums in 2015.

item.title: Hope ICC suspending SLC does not affect our schedule, U19 World Cup: Skipper Mendis
item.description: The Sri Lankan cricket team captain, Kusal Mendis, expressed concern over the suspension of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) by the International Cricket Council (ICC), hoping that it won't affect the team's upcoming fixtures and preparations for the men's U19 World Cup. Sri Lanka is scheduled to host Zimbabwe for a limited-overs series in January-February 2024, followed by the U19 World Cup starting on January 13. The ICC suspended SLC due to government interference after the Sri Lankan parliament passed a resolution calling for the sacking of the country's cricket governing body. Mendis acknowledged the team's recent poor performance against India but mentioned that they had shown resilience despite being bowled out for low scores. The article also mentions the appointment of an interim committee and the efforts to address deficiencies in the team's performance.

item.title: Israeli drama ‘Fauda’ crew member reported dead in Gaza
item.description: A crew member from the popular Israeli TV series "Fauda" named Matan Meir has been reported killed in action in Gaza. Meir, a reservist in Israel’s 551st Brigade’s 697th Battalion, was announced in an IDF list of soldiers who died in the line of duty. The social media team of "Fauda" also confirmed his death and expressed condolences. Meir was involved in the production of other shows as well. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu labeled Hamas as part of the axis of terrorism led by Iran, endangering the Middle East and Arab world. He urged Arab leaders to stand against Hamas. Netanyahu emphasized that Israel's war against Hamas is advancing at "full force" with the goal of victory and eliminating Hamas.

item.title: Abu Dhabi Department of Culture and Tourism reopens Delma Museum following restoration
item.description: The Delma Museum in Abu Dhabi has reopened after a major restoration project. Located on Delma Island, the museum offers visitors a glimpse into the city's history through a collection of artifacts that tell the story of the house, pearl trade, and daily life on the island over a century ago. The museum features a reception room, a windcatcher system that funnels breeze into the reception room, and date presses used to extract date molasses. The restoration initiative included repairing the building, combating rising dampness, and conserving decorative elements. Future plans involve the conservation of historic mosques, the development of site management and heritage masterplans, and the protection of Delma's cultural heritage for future generations.

item.title: UAE President honours winners of Abu Dhabi World Jiu-Jitsu Awards 2023
item.description: The President of the UAE, Sheikh Zayed bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, has honored the winners of the Abu Dhabi World Jiu-Jitsu Awards 2023. The ceremony took place after the conclusion of the 15th Abu Dhabi World Professional Jiu-Jitsu Championship, which attracted 7,000 athletes from 127 countries. Sheikh Zayed praised the role of the event in promoting jiu-jitsu and supporting athletes to excel on a global level. He also highlighted Abu Dhabi's status as the global capital for the sport and commended the emirate's talent programs. The awards ceremony recognized winners in 20 categories and celebrated outstanding performances by athletes at local, regional, and international levels. The event was attended by various dignitaries, including representatives from national embassies and the UAE Jiu-Jitsu Federation.

item.title: Do you know exposure to broccoli sprouts protects against colitis in bowel disease? Study reveals
item.description: A study published in the American Society for Microbiology journal mSystems found that diets high in fiber, particularly those that include broccoli sprouts or other cruciferous vegetables, could help mice with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) live longer and improve their well-being. The researchers examined the impact of a broccoli sprout diet on the immune systems of the mice and the microbes in their gut affected by Crohn's disease. They also studied the reduction of Crohn's symptoms and the anti-inflammatory compounds found in broccoli sprouts. The study involved IL-10-ko mice divided into different diet groups and used new healthy mice to trigger symptoms of colitis and Crohn's disease. The researchers examined gut tissues and microbial communities in the intestines of the mice. They found that the mice on the broccoli sprout diet had higher levels of the anti-inflammatory metabolite sulforaphane in their blood, resulting in milder disease symptoms. The study also revealed that younger mice responded better to the diet and had stronger gut bacterial communities compared to adolescent mice.

item.title: Researchers find obesity associated with neurodegeneration via insulin resistance
item.description: Researchers at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Centre in the United States have discovered a link between obesity and neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's. Using fruit flies, the study found that a high-sugar diet, which is common in obesity, causes insulin resistance in the brain. This impairs the brain's ability to eliminate neuronal debris, increasing the risk of neurodegeneration. The findings could have implications for medications aimed at reducing the risk of neurodegenerative diseases. The study provides insight into how obesity-inducing diets may contribute to the development of these disorders.

item.title: NIA files charge-sheet in cross-border arms smuggling case in Punjab
item.description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has filed a charge-sheet against a man named Malkit Singh in a case related to the smuggling of arms and ammunition by drones in Punjab's Gurdaspur district. The case was initially registered in March after the seizure of firearms and ammunition by Border Security Force personnel. The NIA re-registered the case in August and found connections between members of the Khalistan Liberation Force (KLF) and individuals in Pakistan. The KLF and the International Sikh Youth Federation (ISYF) were banned by the government for their involvement in armed attacks and other criminal activities.

item.title: WW2 veterans eye 80th anniversary of D-Day as Europe salutes war dead
item.description: An 98-year-old English soldier named Ken Hay, who was captured during a night patrol in 1944 behind German lines, is now raising funds for an educational pavilion to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings and the Battle of Normandy. The British Normandy Memorial, which was built on former farmland and financed by fines levied on banks and private donations, honors the 22,440 servicemen and two servicewomen who died under British command between June 6 and August 31, 1944. The memorial, which features 160 stone columns and a ceremonial wall, is laid out chronologically by date of death.

item.title: Maharashtra CM Shinde dismisses Uddhav’s threat over demolition of Shiv Sena (UBT) shakha

item.title: Man dies while trying to save son from downing in Odisha
item.description: A man named Saroj Sahu died while trying to rescue his eight-year-old son from drowning in the Kathajodi River in Odisha's Cuttack district. The incident occurred at the Kaibartasahi Ghat when both the father and son went to bathe in the river. The minor boy slipped into the strong current of the river, leading Saroj to go into the deep water to save him. Saroj managed to pull his son up, but he drowned in the process. Local women saved the minor boy, while fishermen later retrieved Saroj's body. He was pronounced dead at the SCB Medical College and Hospital in Cuttack.

item.title: Japanese island holds disaster drill in shadow of Taiwan threat
item.description: Japan conducted a tsunami evacuation drill on Yonaguni Island, its westernmost island, involving about 200 island officials and military personnel. The exercise aimed to prepare residents for potential emergencies, including any conflict arising from China's attempt to control Taiwan. Due to strong winds, helicopters and landing craft were unable to participate. The mayor emphasized the need to plan for worst-case scenarios, considering Japan's vulnerability to earthquake-triggered tsunamis. The official in charge of disaster preparedness highlighted the proximity of Yonaguni to Taiwan and the importance of being prepared for both natural disasters and conflicts. Concerns over China's military activities and the situation in Ukraine prompted Japan's Prime Minister to announce plans to double defense spending.

item.title: Unless extraordinary, Constitutional Court should avoid fixing time-bound schedule for cases: SC
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Supreme Court of India has stated that the Constitutional Court should only fix a time-bound schedule for the disposal of cases if the situation is extraordinary. The court made this observation while rejecting a plea that sought directions for the timely disposal of a criminal matter. Justices Abhay S Oka and Pankaj Mithal highlighted the large number of bail petitions filed in high courts, which inevitably leads to some delays in their disposal. The court emphasized that unless there is an exceptional urgency, fixing a time-bound schedule should be avoided. However, it assured that genuine requests for urgent matters can be entertained by the concerned bench.

item.title: Arab League, OIC dismiss Israel’s ‘right to self defence’, call for ICC probe into ‘war crimes’
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Middle East rivals Iran and Saudi Arabia joined forces at a joint summit of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) and the Arab League in Riyadh to reject Israel's claim of self-defense. They called on the International Criminal Court (ICC) to investigate Israel for war crimes and crimes against humanity in Palestine. The summit, attended by leaders from various Arab and Islamic nations, marked Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi's first visit to Saudi Arabia since ties were restored earlier this year. The emergency summit was prompted by Israel's response to attacks by Hamas, resulting in numerous deaths, including many children. The joint resolution adopted at the summit condemned Israel's aggression and affirmed Palestinians' right to self-determination, an independent state, and their demand for Jerusalem as its capital. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan proposed an international peace conference, while Raisi blamed the US for enabling Israel's atrocities. The OIC and the Arab League also called for the establishment of a nuclear-weapon-free-zone in the Middle East and the elimination of other weapons of mass destruction in the region. Disagreements arose among the leaders regarding severing diplomatic ties with Israel, with some advocating for it and others emphasizing the importance of maintaining dialogue.

item.title: Saira Banu shares throwback picture with Dilip Kumar on Diwali
item.description: Veteran Bollywood star Saira Banu celebrated Diwali with actor Dilip Kumar and shared a throwback picture of them together. In her Instagram post, she reflected on the significance of Diwali and how it symbolizes the victory of good over evil. Banu wished for collective prosperity and resilience and expressed her hope that the festival would ignite introspection and self-discovery. She concluded by sending her best wishes to her fans and emphasized the importance of the enduring spirit that connects everyone. Saira Banu made her acting debut in 1961 and has appeared in numerous films throughout her career.

item.title: Diwali: Gippy Grewal unveils motion poster of action thriller ‘Warning 2’
item.description: The makers of the action thriller film 'Warning 2' starring Gippy Grewal and Prince Kanwaljit Singh unveiled the motion poster on Diwali. Gippy Grewal, who wrote the film, shared the poster on Instagram and announced that the movie will be released in cinemas on February 2, 2024. In addition to 'Warning 2', Gippy Grewal will also be seen in the thriller titled 'Chamak' and the film 'Shinda Shinda No Papa'. He is also collaborating with actor Sanjay Dutt for a Punjabi film called 'Sheran Di Kaum Punjabi'. Furthermore, Gippy Grewal has another film titled 'Carry On Jattiye' featuring Jasmin Bhasin, Sunil Grover, and Sargun Mehta.

item.title: Cement industry’s new ‘EV’ – A new low-carbon tech is here
item.description: The construction of cities equivalent to the size of New York City every month is being driven by population growth and urbanization. However, this rapid urban development is putting increased pressure on the planet and its natural resources because concrete and cement, which are key construction materials, contribute approximately 7% of global CO2 emissions. To address this issue, the World Economic Forum, in collaboration with Boston Consulting Group and industry input from the Global Cement and Concrete Association, has developed a framework to reduce concrete emissions. The framework suggests three key strategies: decarbonizing the manufacturing process, using lower-carbon cement blends, and optimizing the volume of material used in projects. One potential solution for decarbonizing cement production is an electric chemical approach that replaces fossil fuel kilns with an ambient temperature process. This approach aims to achieve true zero carbon and can be a high-performance, low-carbon building material. The journey of developing sustainable cement production technology serves as a lesson that good ideas can come from anywhere.

item.title: Masaba celebrates Diwali with dad Vivian Richards, calls it “special”
item.description: Designer Masaba Gupta celebrated Diwali with her father, cricketer Vivian Richards, who visited India for the festivities. She shared pictures on Instagram, including one of her posing with her dad. Masaba and her husband also performed the Diwali puja at her office. Masaba is the daughter of actor Neena Gupta and Vivian Richards, who had her out of wedlock. They have lived separately throughout their lives. Neena raised Masaba alone until she got married to Vivek Mehra in 2008. Vivian had previously visited India in January 2023 to attend Masaba's wedding with Satyadeep Misra. Masaba shared a family picture on Instagram, which included her husband, Satyadeep's mother and sister, Neena Gupta, her husband Vivek Mehra, and Vivian Richards.

item.title: Ranbir Kapoor twins with ‘Jiju’ Saif Ali Khan, Ibrahim in black at Diwali party
item.description: Actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt attended a Diwali bash hosted by Ranbir's cousin Kareena Kapoor Khan in Mumbai. Pictures and videos from the event were shared on social media, including one of Ranbir posing with Saif Ali Khan and Ibrahim Ali Khan. The trio was seen twinning in black ethnic outfits. Ranbir's mother Neetu Kapoor also attended the party, wearing a pink salwar suit. Other celebrities like Arjun Kapoor, Amrita Arora, Karisma Kapoor, Kunal Kemmu, and Soha Ali Khan were also spotted at the event. Kareena and Saif were dressed in traditional attire and shared an adorable picture on Instagram. Ranbir's upcoming film 'Animal' is set to release on December 1 and also stars Rashmika Mandanna, Anil Kapoor, and Bobby Deol.

item.title: Israel-Hamas war: Rocket alerts sounded in evacuated Israeli town near Gaza
item.description: Rocket alerts were heard in the Israeli town of Kissufim near the Gaza Strip, with no reports of impacts or casualties. The town had been previously evacuated. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu referred to Hamas as an "integral part of the axis of terrorism" and urged Arab leaders to speak out against them. He stated that Israel's war against Hamas is advancing at "full force" with the goal of victory and the return of hostages. Netanyahu claimed that Hamas has lost control of the northern Gaza Strip.

item.title: NHL roundup: Blues blitz Avs behind 2 hat tricks
item.description:
The St. Louis Blues dominated the Colorado Avalanche with an 8-2 victory, thanks to hat tricks from Brayden Schenn and Pavel Buchnevich. Schenn now has four career hat tricks, while Buchnevich has three. Torey Krug, Alexey Toropchenko, and Robert Thomas also contributed to the Blues' win. Mikko Rantanen and Jack Johnson scored for the Avalanche.
In another game, the Montreal Canadiens defeated the Boston Bruins 3-2 in overtime, with Kaiden Guhle scoring the winning goal. Nick Suzuki and Brendan Gallagher also found the net for Montreal, while Brad Marchand had a goal and an assist for Boston.
The Edmonton Oilers snapped a four-game losing streak by defeating the Seattle Kraken 4-1. Zach Hyman scored a natural hat trick, and Dylan Holloway also scored for the Oilers. Jaden Schwartz scored for the Kraken.
The Detroit Red Wings secured a 5-4 victory over the Columbus Blue Jackets, with Daniel Sprong scoring the go-ahead goal. Lucas Raymond, Alex DeBrincat, Robby Fabbri, and Jake Walman also scored for the Red Wings, while Patrik Laine scored his 200th career goal for the Blue Jackets.
The Dallas Stars emerged victorious with a 3-2 win against the Winnipeg Jets, thanks to goals from Wyatt Johnston, Thomas Harley, and Matt Duchene. Cole Perfetti and Brenden Dillon scored for the Jets.
The Ottawa Senators defeated the Calgary Flames 4-1, ending their five-game home skid. Drake Batherson, Mathieu Joseph, Rourke Chartier, and Travis Hamonic scored for the Senators, while Blake Coleman scored for the Flames.
The Carolina Hurricanes shut out the Tampa Bay Lightning 4-0, with Pyotr Kochetkov recording his fifth career shutout. Sebastian Aho and Brent Burns each had a goal and an assist for the Hurricanes.
The Toronto Maple Leafs defeated the Vancouver Canucks 5-2, with Noah Gregor scoring the go-ahead goal. Matthew Knies, William Nylander, Nicholas Robertson, and David Kampf also found the net for the Maple Leafs, while J.T. Miller and Pius Suter scored for the Canucks.
The Washington Capitals secured a 4-1 win over the New York Islanders, with goals from Nic Dowd, Aliaksei Protas, and Alex Ovechkin, who moved closer to Wayne Gretzky's all-time goal record. Alexander Romanov scored for the Islanders.
The Pittsburgh Penguins blanked the Buffalo Sabres 4-0, with Erik Karlsson scoring twice and Tristan Jarry making 35 saves.
The Arizona Coyotes defeated the Nashville Predators 7-5, with Michael Carcone scoring two goals and Sean Durzi netting the game-winner. Filip Forsberg scored two goals for the Predators.
The Philadelphia Flyers snapped the Los Angeles Kings' eight-game point streak with a 4-2 victory. Morgan Frost scored two goals for the Flyers, while Cal Petersen made 35 saves in net.

item.title: UP CM Adityanath extends Diwali greetings to people
item.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath extended Diwali greetings to the people of the state, wishing them happiness, prosperity, good fortune, and health. He visited the Hanumangarhi temple and the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya, offering prayers. Adityanath met with seers and inquired about their health. He also convened a meeting with the seers to discuss the consecration of the Ram temple. Deputy Chief Ministers Keshav Prasad Maurya and Brajesh Pathak also extended Diwali wishes to the people. They emphasized the importance of faith, joy, and light during the festival.

item.title: Motorcycling-Bastianini wins Malaysian Grand Prix, Bagnaia extends championship lead
item.description: Ducati's Enea Bastianini secured his first victory of the season in the Malaysian Grand Prix, with Gresini's Alex Marquez finishing second. The race saw Bastianini and Marquez quickly pull ahead of championship leader Francesco Bagnaia and Jorge Martin on the opening lap. Bagnaia ultimately finished third, while Martin came in fourth, falling 14 points behind Bagnaia in the championship standings. The MotoGP championship has two remaining races this season in Qatar and Valencia.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.

item.title: Tripura: 14 Bangladeshis held for illegally entering India
item.description: Fourteen Bangladeshi nationals, including four children, were arrested in Tripura's Gomati district for illegally entering India. Acting on a tip-off, raids were conducted at two houses in Baishnabpur village near the international border, and the illegal immigrants were held. Three locals who provided shelter to the Bangladeshi nationals were also arrested. The Sabroom subdivision border, which is 62 km long, is not fully fenced, making it easier for human traffickers to exploit. Authorities are taking a zero-tolerance approach to human trafficking and are booking those involved under stringent charges.

Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Australia's Foreign Minister Penny Wong has stated that a security and migration pact signed with Tuvalu demonstrates Australia's commitment as a reliable regional partner and its efforts to counter China's influence in the Pacific. The pact includes a security guarantee to protect Tuvalu from military aggression and climate change, as well as boost migration. Australia aims to strengthen its standing in the Pacific amid China's increasing presence in the region. The treaty also allows Australia to review Tuvalu's security arrangements with other nations. Tuvalu, a small Pacific Islands nation, is one of the few countries to maintain diplomatic relations with Taiwan.

item.title: Women will get Rs 15,000 annual assistance if Cong retains power in Chhattisgarh: CM Baghel
item.description: Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel of Chhattisgarh announced that if the Congress party remains in power, women in the state will receive an annual financial assistance of Rs 15,000. This announcement is seen as a response to the opposition BJP's promise of providing Rs 12,000 per year to married women. The assistance will be directly deposited into the bank accounts of eligible women under the "Chhattisgarh Gruha Lakshmi Yojana." The first phase of polling has already taken place, and the second phase is scheduled for November 17.

item.title: Sanjay Dutt posts fam-jam picture with Diwali wish

The photo featured Sanjay, his wife Maanayata Dutt, and their children Shahraan and Iqra. Diwali, also known as the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of light over darkness and good over evil. item.title: ‘The Swimmer’, ‘The Donna Reed Show’ actor Janet Landgard passes away at 75
item.description: Actor Janet Landgard, known for her roles in "The Swimmer" and "The Donna Reed Show," has passed away at the age of 75. Her co-star Paul Petersen shared the news on Facebook, revealing that she had lost her battle with cancer. Landgard made her television debut in 1963 on "The Donna Reed Show" and went on to portray Petersen's girlfriend on the show. She was also featured on the TV special "The Hollywood Deb Stars of 1965" and hosted "Dream Girl of '67."

item.title: 3 arrested in sisters’ suicide in Agra ashram
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Three people have been arrested in connection with the suicide of two sisters at the Brahma Kumaris Ashram in Jagner. The sisters left behind a note naming four individuals responsible for their actions. The police have recovered their mobile phones and filed an FIR under section 306 of the Indian Penal Code. The sisters had been living in the ashram for several years and accused their cousin, uncle, a member of the ashram, and a relative of driving them to suicide. The dispute allegedly stemmed from a sum of Rs 25 lakh. Three of the accused have been arrested, while a search is ongoing for the fourth.

item.title: You dream of playing against India at Wankhede; we will stay level in semis: Rachin Ravindra
item.description: New Zealand's batsman Rachin Ravindra is confident that his team will stay focused in their World Cup semifinal match against India at the Wankhede Stadium. Ravindra has been in exceptional form, scoring three centuries in the tournament. He believes that although India is unbeaten at the Wankhede, New Zealand will give their best. The 23-year-old acknowledges that winning every game is not possible, but they will see how it plays out. He highlights the experience of the players in the team who have previously played in big matches against teams like Australia and England. Ravindra is excited about the match against India, especially since he has a special connection with Bengaluru, where the match will take place. He credits the depth in New Zealand's squad for their success despite injuries to key players. Ravindra also mentions the influence of his senior opening partner, Devon Conway, on his batting.

item.title: Kajol celebrates 30 years of ‘Baazigar’
item.description: Kajol celebrated the 30th anniversary of her film 'Baazigar' this Diwali. She reminisced about her first-time experiences working with Shah Rukh Khan, Shilpa Shetty, and Johnny Lever. Kajol shared stills from the film and expressed her fond memories and laughter on the set. Fans expressed their nostalgia and admiration for the movie, calling it amazing and rewatchable. Released in 1993, 'Baazigar' was a blockbuster and featured Shah Rukh Khan in an anti-hero role, marking one of Kajol's earliest successes and Shilpa Shetty's debut. The film's dialogues and songs are still popular among fans today, with SRK's line "kabhi kabhi jeetne ke liye kuch haarna bhi padta hai" remaining memorable.

item.title: Uttarakhand: Tunnel under construction on Yamunotri NH partially collapses, 40 workers trapped
item.description: A tunnel under construction on the Brahmakhal-Yamunotri National Highway in Uttarakhand collapsed, trapping around 40 workers inside. The incident occurred early in the morning when a 150-meter portion of the four-and-a-half-kilometer tunnel collapsed. Rescue operations have been launched by the Uttarkashi Superintendent of Police and various emergency response teams. The tunnel is part of the Char Dham all-weather road project and its construction aims to reduce the journey between Uttarkashi and Yamunotri by 26 kilometers.A portion of a tunnel under construction on the Brahmakhal-Yamunotri national highway in Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand collapsed, trapping around 40 workers inside. The incident occurred around 4 am when a 150-meter-long section of the four-and-a-half-kilometer-long tunnel collapsed. Various rescue teams, including the National Disaster Response Force, State Disaster Response Force, fire brigade, and employees of the organization building the tunnel, are working to rescue the trapped laborers. The tunnel is part of the Char Dham all-weather road project, which aims to reduce the journey between Uttarkashi and Yamunotri by 26 km.

item.title: Bihar govt warns newly appointed teachers of strict disciplinary action if they form association
item.description: The Bihar government has issued a warning to newly recruited teachers, stating that if they form or join any associations and participate in protests against the education department's policies, their appointments may be cancelled. The warning comes after around 1.20 lakh teachers who cleared the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) recruitment exam in 2023 received provisional appointment letters. The education department stated that while these teachers have not yet been assigned postings or started teaching, some have formed or joined an association and criticized the department's policies. The department emphasized that forming a union or being part of one is not allowed, and strict disciplinary action will be taken, including cancellation of appointments, if guilty. The article also mentions that 1.20 lakh candidates cleared the BPSC examination for 1.70 lakh teaching positions in Bihar.

item.title: Oil price rise would hit 2024 global growth, inflation outlook: Fitch
item.description: Higher oil prices resulting from the ongoing conflict in the Middle East could lead to lower economic growth and higher inflation, according to Fitch Ratings. The rating agency estimates that world GDP growth would be 0.4 percentage points lower in 2024 and 0.1 percentage points lower in 2025. Fitch's simulations assume average oil prices of $120 per barrel in 2024 and $100 per barrel in 2025. The impact of higher oil prices would dampen GDP growth in most economies, with South Africa and Turkey being the most affected. Fitch also expects higher inflation rates in 2024, followed by corrections in 2025. The potential oil price shock could result in tighter financial conditions, lower business and consumer confidence, and corrections in financial markets.

item.title: James Gunn confirms ‘Superman: Legacy’ is still on track, check out release date
item.description: Filmmaker James Gunn confirmed that his upcoming superhero film 'Superman: Legacy' is still on track for its planned release date of July 11, 2025. Despite the strikes by WGA and SAG-AFTRA, the film's talented crew continued to work diligently, creating impressive character and set designs. The movie will portray Superman's journey as Clark Kent of Smallville, Kansas, as he navigates his Kryptonian heritage and human upbringing. Actor David Corenswet will play the lead role of Clark Kent, replacing Henry Cavill, while Rachel Brosnahan will portray Lois Lane. Cavill had previously played the superhero in various DC comics films.

item.title: WHO loses communication with Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has lost communication with Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza City, where repeated attacks have been reported. The hospital is said to be surrounded by tanks, and the safety of health workers, patients, and displaced people inside is a grave concern for the WHO. The organization is calling for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire in Gaza to save lives and reduce suffering. They also emphasize the need for medical evacuations of critically injured patients and the release of hostages. The conflict between Israel and Hamas has intensified, with reports of Hamas maintaining a major command center in tunnels. Jerusalem has urged hospital staff, patients, and other Gazans to flee south to avoid further attacks, but there are reports of gunfire targeting those trying to leave. The WHO is advocating for safe medical evacuations into Egypt through the Rafah Border Crossing.

item.title: NBA roundup: Magic’s balanced attack too strong for Bucks
item.description:
Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Orlando Magic defeated the Milwaukee Bucks 112-97, with Paolo Banchero scoring 26 points and Franz Wagner adding 24. Despite Giannis Antetokounmpo's 35-point, 10-rebound performance, the Bucks couldn't secure a win. Jalen Suggs contributed 20 points for Orlando, while Moritz Wagner scored 19 off the bench. The Magic dominated in second-chance points, outscoring the Bucks 22-4 in that category.
In another game, the Cleveland Cavaliers beat the Golden State Warriors 118-110, completing a season-series sweep. Caris LeVert led the Cavaliers with 22 points off the bench, supported by Donovan Mitchell, Darius Garland, and Evan Mobley, who all scored in double figures. Stephen Curry scored 30 points for the Warriors but struggled with his three-point shooting. The Cavaliers snapped a 12-game losing streak against the Warriors.
The Boston Celtics defeated the Toronto Raptors 117-94 behind Jaylen Brown's 29 points and Jayson Tatum's 27 points. Pascal Siakam led the Raptors with 17 points, but it wasn't enough to overcome the Celtics' strong performance. The Celtics improved their home record to 4-0.
Finally, the Miami Heat earned a 117-109 victory over the Atlanta Hawks. Bam Adebayo recorded 26 points and 17 rebounds, while rookie Jaime Jaquez Jr. had a season-high 20 points. Jimmy Butler sat out for the Heat due to a personal family issue. Trae Young scored 27 points and had 11 assists for the Hawks, but it wasn't sufficient to secure a win.

item.title: Australia says ports operator cyber incident ‘serious’
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Australian government has described a cybersecurity incident at ports operator DP World Australia as "serious and ongoing." The incident, which began on Friday, has forced the suspension of operations at ports in several states. DP World Australia, which manages nearly half of the country's goods flow, is investigating possible data breaches and testing crucial systems for the resumption of normal operations. The breach has affected container terminals in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, and Fremantle. The Australian Federal Police are investigating the incident, and the National Cyber Security Coordinator has warned that the interruption is likely to continue for several days, impacting the movement of goods in and out of the country. DP World operates in 18 locations in the Asia-Pacific region and is part of Dubai's state-owned DP World.

item.title: In UN talks for a global plastic treaty, delegates to face off over production limits
item.description: Negotiations are underway for the creation of a treaty to address plastic pollution, and officials are divided on whether to limit plastic production or focus on waste management. The world currently produces around 400 million tonnes of plastic waste annually, with less than 10% being recycled. The European Union and several countries advocate for binding provisions to reduce plastic production and eliminate problematic plastics, while the plastic industry and oil-exporting nations argue for a focus on recycling and reusing plastics. The United States has shifted its stance, now calling for national plans that align with global goals to reduce plastic pollution. Environmental groups hope the discussions can move past procedural matters and focus on substantive solutions.

item.title: Myanmar fighter jet crashes, rebels claim responsibility
item.description: A Myanmar fighter jet crashed during clashes between the military and an insurgent group in eastern Myanmar. The jet went down over Kayah State near the border with Thailand, with both the military and the Karenni Nationalities Defence Force claiming responsibility for shooting it down. The military stated that the crash was due to a technical problem and that the pilots had ejected safely. This incident adds to the challenges faced by the ruling junta, as it battles opposition forces on multiple fronts. Ethnic minority groups and anti-junta militias are coordinating a rebellion that poses a significant threat to the military's rule. The conflict in Shan State, which borders China, has displaced thousands of people and disrupted trade routes. China has called for all sides to cease hostilities. An alliance of insurgent groups claims to have seized over 100 army posts, and attacks on towns have occurred in Sagaing Region. The fighting has left hundreds of foreign workers, including nationals from Vietnam and Thailand, trapped in the conflict zone. The Thai government has stated that it is awaiting an opportunity to evacuate its citizens. The Karenni Nationalities Defence Force stated on Facebook that it shot down the jet using heavy machine guns and is currently searching for the pilots, but this information could not be verified. Images of an abandoned helmet and parachute believed to belong to one of the pilots were posted on social media.

item.title: Toll in Kerala blasts rises to 5
item.description: The death toll from the blasts that occurred at a Christian religious gathering near Kochi, Kerala, has now reached five, according to the Kerala government. A 45-year-old woman named Sally Pradeepan passed away on Saturday night at a private hospital where she was receiving ventilator support. Currently, 17 people injured in the blasts are being treated in various hospitals, with eight in intensive care units (ICU) and one in critical condition. The incident took place on October 29 during a prayer meeting of the Jehovah’s Witnesses, resulting in over 50 injuries. A man named Dominic Martin, claiming to be an estranged member of the sect, surrendered to the police and confessed to carrying out the multiple blasts. He has been arrested and charged under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Explosive Substances Act, as well as the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act.

item.title: Owning pet may not be linked with well-being, despite improving owner’s life, research finds
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.A study conducted by researchers from Michigan State University found that there is no reliable association between pet ownership and well-being. The study involved 767 participants who completed online surveys, and while pet owners reported that their pets improved their lives, there was no difference in the well-being of pet owners compared to non-pet owners over time. The study also found that the type of pet, the number of pets, and the quality of the human-pet relationship did not affect the association. The researchers suggested that non-pet owners may have other sources of happiness in their lives. They concluded that while pets may provide positive experiences, they may not have a transformative effect on overall well-being.

item.title: Pakistan: Three police personnel killed in terrorist attack in Tank
item.description: Three police personnel, including a station house officer (SHO), were killed and five others, including a deputy superintendent of police, were injured in a terrorist attack in Pakistan's Tank. The attack occurred when the police were attempting to arrest kidnappers. The injured personnel were taken to a hospital, and security forces have launched operations against the terrorists. This incident is part of a rise in terror activities in Pakistan, particularly in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan. In the first nine months of 2023, 386 security personnel lost their lives, reaching an eight-year high. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan accounted for the majority of fatalities and attacks during this time.

item.title: Uttarakhand: Tunnel under construction on Yamunotri National Highway partially collapses, 40 workers trapped
item.description: A tunnel under construction on the Brahmakhal-Yamunotri national highway in Uttarkashi district, Uttarakhand collapsed, trapping approximately 40 workers inside. The incident occurred at around 4 am when a 150-meter portion of the four-and-a-half-kilometer tunnel collapsed. Uttarkashi Superintendent of Police, Arpan Yaduvanshi, immediately launched a relief and rescue operation with the National Disaster Response Force, State Disaster Response Force, fire brigade, and employees of the National Highways and Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (NHIDCL) also present. The construction of this tunnel, part of the Char Dham road project, aims to reduce the travel distance between Uttarkashi and Yamunotri Dham by 26 kilometers.

item.title: England retain six World Cup squad members for Caribbean tour, Buttler remains captain
item.description: England has retained six players, including captain Jos Buttler, from their World Cup squad for the limited-overs tour of the West Indies. The defending champions failed to reach the World Cup semifinals in India, winning only three of their nine league games. Ben Stokes, who came out of ODI retirement for the World Cup, will not be part of the ODI and T20I squads for the West Indies series due to a knee surgery. Uncapped seamers Josh Tongue and John Turners are included in both squads. England will play three ODIs and five T20Is in the Caribbean.

item.title: Diwali car discounts make for a great deal. But don’t drive home a soon-to-be extinct SUV
item.description:
The Indian automotive industry has experienced a swift rebound after the challenges of 2020, with consistent monthly sales growth over the past two years. It is predicted that by March 2024, the Indian passenger car market will surpass four million units, making it the world's third-largest car market behind China and the United States.
However, Chief Operating Officer of Hyundai Motor India, Tarun Garg, raises concerns about the current situation. He points out that rival carmakers are offering massive discounts on their flagship products during the Diwali season, suggesting that there may be underlying issues despite the apparent positive growth. Garg predicts a decline in growth as 2024 approaches, marking the end of a period of intense expansion.
Data from the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) indicates that sales of passenger cars in October 2023 grew by 15.87% compared to the previous year. While major manufacturers like Hyundai saw their sales increase by close to 15%, smaller players such as Renault, Nissan, and Citroen experienced significant declines. This could be due to a lack of suitable products, although even established carmakers like Honda have resorted to offering attractive discounts to drive sales growth.
Discounts are not limited to the mainstream market and can also be found in the luxury segment. Luxury carmakers offer attractive loan deals through their finance arms to show volumes, often at rates lower than those offered by banks. There are also instances where dealers are asked to pick up cars to demonstrate monthly volumes, which are then sold off as unregistered vehicles at significant discounts.
The shift towards electric vehicles (EVs) has created confusion among Indian consumers. Currently, the EV market offers limited choices, mostly retrofitted variants of internal-combustion engine cars. However, purpose-built EVs are expected to enter the market around 2025-26, providing better options for consumers. Major automakers like Tata Motors, Mahindra, Maruti-Suzuki, Hyundai, and Kia are working on upcoming EV models.
Despite potential economic uncertainty after the 2024 Lok Sabha election, Hyundai remains committed to its plans for a 'Made In India' EV, similar to a C-segment SUV, by 2025. This raises the question of whether buying a new vehicle at this time might lead to owning a car that could become obsolete in a few years.
In summary, while the Indian automotive industry has shown impressive growth, concerns about underlying issues such as discounts, declining sales for some manufacturers, and the impending shift towards EVs raise questions about the future of the market.

item.title: Bangladeshi Muslims are building a 300-yr-old Kali temple. Now they want Modi’s help
item.description:
The 300-year-old Sasan Kali temple in Bangladesh's Magura district was partially destroyed in the 2000 floods. Now, both Muslims and Hindus are coming together to rebuild the temple and are seeking assistance from the governments of Bangladesh and India. The village of Basurdhuljhuri, where the temple is located, serves as a symbol of secularism in a country that has been witnessing communal violence during Hindu festivities.
Every year, journalist Sahidul Hasan Khokon returns to his native village for the Kali pujo at the temple. This year, he and his friends plan to form a committee to restore the temple to its original glory. Despite its current modest appearance, the temple attracts millions of devotees who believe that their wishes will be granted by the goddess Kali.
In 2001, there was no Kali pujo due to the flood, but Muslim neighbors contributed funds and resources to help construct a temporary temple for the Hindus in the village. Now, the community wants to build a proper temple and hopes for support from both the Bangladeshi and Indian governments. They cite a similar project funded by India in Natore district as a precedent.
The Kali temple at Basurdhuljhuri holds historical significance and requires a budget of at least fifteen lakh Bangladeshi Taka for construction. Bengali Hindus in West Bengal and Bangladesh worship Goddess Kali during Diwali, and the Sasan Kali form is revered in certain temples like the one in Basurdhuljhuri.
The story of Hindus and Muslims coming together to rebuild a Kali temple is seen as an example of syncretic culture defeating fundamentalist forces in Bangladesh. Many individuals, such as actress Ashna Habib Bhabna, appreciate this display of unity and hope for the prompt construction of the temple.
For Sahidul Hasan Khokon, supporting the temple's restoration is not only about rebuilding a part of his childhood, but also about defending his belief system in the face of temple attacks. He hopes that both the Bangladeshi and Indian governments will help restore this shared heritage.

item.title: Power supply, healthcare facilities remain concern for Asia’s oldest monastery
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The head of the Tawang Monastery in Arunachal Pradesh, Asia's oldest monastery, has expressed concerns about the lack of accessible medical care and uninterrupted power supply. Abbot Shedling Tulku Thupten Tendar Rinpoche is pleased with the discipline and dedication of the monks but highlights the need for healthcare facilities within the monastery instead of having to travel long distances for emergencies. He also requests the government to ensure uninterrupted power supply to benefit not only the monks but also the increasing number of visitors, including tourists and VIPs. Additionally, Rinpoche raises concerns about the growing environmental issues caused by visitors littering around the monastery and urges them to be more conscious. Regarding the younger generation's involvement in religion, he suggests blending religious teachings with scientific perspectives to make it more relevant and emphasizes that Buddhism is about the journey of the mind and consciousness toward enlightenment. Lastly, he highlights the importance of helping others and maintaining unity among faith followers.

item.title: People dig deeper to fact-check social media posts when paired with someone who doesn’t share their perspective – new research
item.description: A recent study published in Frontiers in Psychology found that people are more likely to fact-check social media posts and revise their initial beliefs when paired with someone from a different cultural background. The study focused on English and French participants and found that when paired with someone from the same cultural background, participants tended to confirm their initial beliefs, while those paired with someone from a different cultural background engaged in deeper searches and revised their beliefs in line with evidence. The researchers believe that bringing together people from opposing sides to fact-check contentious social media posts could improve media literacy and civil discourse. However, it may be challenging to get people from opposing sides to engage in such discussions. The researchers plan to conduct future studies on more controversial topics to further explore the effects of mismatched pairs.

item.title: India’s creative talent has a ‘refuge’ near Chennai – the Cholamandal Artists’ Village
item.description: The Cholamandal Artists' Village is a modernist artist community located outside Chennai, India. It was established in 1966 by KCS Paniker as a refuge for artists to live and work in, focusing on their artistic practice and promoting the exchange of creative ideas. The village includes artists' studios, a contemporary art gallery, handicrafts association offices, a metalsmith workshop, and an open-air theater for discussions and conferences. The artists sustain themselves by producing handicrafts alongside their artistic practice. The village also features an international sculpture park and publishes an art journal called Artrends. It has gained international acclaim and has been showcased at various art festivals and exhibitions. While the original format of the village as a commune has shifted, it continues to be overseen by the Artists Handicrafts Association.

item.title: Top US official Brett McGurk to visit Israel: Report
item.description: Brett McGurk, the White House Coordinator for West Asia, is reportedly traveling to Israel as part of a visit to countries in the region. The goal of his visit is to reach a US-brokered deal for the release of hostages being held by Hamas in Gaza. Before visiting Israel, McGurk will hold talks with NATO and European Union officials in Brussels. In Israel, he is scheduled to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, and senior security and intelligence officials. After his visit to Israel, McGurk will travel to Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and Bahrain. The report suggests that one option under discussion is a deal that could release 80 women and children from captivity in Gaza in exchange for Israel releasing female and underage terror convicts from prison. US President Joe Biden has stated that there is "no possibility" of a ceasefire in Gaza and that the US government will continue its efforts to secure the release of the hostages.

item.title: Shadab backs skipper Babar, calls for change in cultural mindset
item.description: Pakistan's vice-captain, Shadab Khan, has called for a change in the "cultural" mindset surrounding blame on the captain for the team's poor performance in the World Cup. Former Pakistan cricketers have demanded the removal of Babar Azam as captain, but Shadab believes the responsibility for the defeats should not solely rest on the captain's shoulders. Babar's captaincy has come under scrutiny, and there has been talk of making wholesale changes in the team, including removing him as skipper. Shadab also expressed disappointment in his own performance and the team's failure to adapt to modern-day cricket. Meanwhile, England leg-spinner Adil Rashid, the team's leading wicket-taker in the World Cup, hopes it's not his last outing for England's ODI cricket. Rashid dismissed Shadab with a googly, which became one of the highlights of England's win against Pakistan.

item.title: Reading ‘Modi’ script, mapping family trees — how Maharashtra’s scouring old records to identify Kunbis
item.description: The Maharashtra government is working to identify all Marathas who were once part of the Kunbi caste before the January 2 deadline for their reservation quota. District officials are scrambling to complete the identification process, with more than 300-400 government officials involved in each taluka. The government has directed districts to search various documents and publish Kunbi references found. Afterward, people will be asked to submit claims for caste certificates based on their genealogy. However, there are challenges such as old and delicate records, missing last names, and discrepancies between siblings' castes. Scanning the documents has been a challenge, with smartphone cameras being used due to the issues with regular scanners. The records are in different scripts, so Modi script readers and translators have been employed to identify the word "Kunbi" in various formats. Despite the difficulties, progress is being made, with some districts having already found thousands of Kunbi records.

item.title: Soccer-Rapinoe suffers ‘devastating’ early exit with injury in final match
item.description: Megan Rapinoe, a two-time World Cup winner, expressed devastation after her final professional match ended prematurely due to injury. The highly anticipated showdown between her team, OL Reign, and Gotham FC, was meant to serve as an emotional farewell for Rapinoe and her former teammate Ali Krieger. However, Rapinoe sustained a non-contact injury just three minutes into the game, grasping at her right calf before limping off the field. The 2019 Ballon d'Or winner believes she tore her Achilles tendon but is awaiting further testing to confirm. Despite the disappointing ending, Rapinoe remains positive and grateful for her career. Gotham FC went on to win the match 2-1 and claim their first championship title. Rapinoe's early exit from her final match shocked fans and fellow U.S. women's national team veterans.

item.title: Unlike AAP’s corruption in Delhi, UP’s excise policy is transparent: UP minister Nitin Agarwal
item.description:
The Uttar Pradesh Excise Minister, Nitin Agarwal, has accused the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government in Delhi of engaging in corrupt practices that benefit the "liquor mafia." He stated that unlike Delhi, where one person can have more than two liquor shops, Uttar Pradesh restricts individuals to a maximum of two liquor shops. Agarwal highlighted that no deaths due to spurious liquor consumption have occurred during the current term of the Yogi Adityanath-led government. The excise policy of the Delhi government for 2021-22 came under scrutiny, leading to a recommendation for a CBI investigation into alleged irregularities by the Lieutenant Governor. Agarwal criticized the AAP for blaming the BJP and suggested that the leaders responsible for the excise scam were involved with the liquor mafia. Both the CBI and the ED are investigating the excise policy cases.
Agarwal emphasized that the UP excise department differs from Delhi's as it provides a level-playing field and operates on a pro-industry policy. He mentioned that the previous policies were not transparent and favored the liquor mafia. The minister stated that the current government welcomes anyone interested in doing business in the state and highlighted the revenue growth of the excise department since the formation of the BJP government in 2017. The target is to reach a revenue figure of Rs 50,000 crore in the current financial year and Rs 80,000 crore by 2027.
Agarwal also mentioned that there have been no deaths due to spurious liquor consumption in Uttar Pradesh during CM Adityanath's second term. He explained that deaths occur when local-level liquor production involves mixing jaggery with urea, which becomes poisonous if methyl alcohol is added. Agarwal assured that country liquor made in distilleries in Uttar Pradesh is safe. The department targets an annual growth rate of 8-10% and sells one crore cases of country liquor per month. Country liquor contributes 44% to the department's total revenue.

item.title: This Diwali season, have one healthy meal a day. Skincare won’t make up for it
item.description: The festive seasons in India can take a toll on the skin, leading to a dull and tired complexion. Winter pollution and indulgence in rich foods can further worsen skin issues. To maintain a glowing complexion, dermatologists recommend taking a vitamin B supplement, drinking plenty of water, and applying moisturizer regularly. Home remedies such as using vinegar and lime juice for dandruff or shampooing with beer can also help. Seeking advice from a dermatologist, especially in areas with heavy pollution, is advised. For specific skin issues, treatments like microdermabrasion and exfoliation creams can be effective. However, it is important not to try new treatments right before important events. Hydration, proper cleansing, and moisturizing are essential steps in a skincare routine. Using a micellar water for makeup removal and a gentle cleanser is recommended. Regular exfoliation and sunscreen application are also important. Additionally, maintaining a healthy diet is crucial for overall skin health. Following these skincare steps can ensure that the skin reflects the joy and brightness of the festive season.
