The deceased were identified as Devi Singh, his wife Maankhor Kanwar, his brother Rajaram, and nephew Jitendra. The SUV carrying the victims rammed into the truck from behind, possibly due to speeding and the truck suddenly applying brakes. Three people died on the spot, and the woman succumbed to her injuries at the hospital. The truck driver fled the scene, and efforts are being made to apprehend him. The bodies are currently at a mortuary, and post-mortem examinations will be conducted later.

item.title: Unlike AAP’s corruption in Delhi, UP’s excise policy is transparent: UP minister Nitin Agarwal
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Excise Minister of Uttar Pradesh, Nitin Agarwal, accused the AAP government in Delhi of engaging in corrupt practices that benefited the "liquor mafia." He claimed that unlike Delhi, where one person could obtain more than two liquor shops, UP had restrictions in place to prevent such concentration. Agarwal stated that there have been no deaths due to spurious liquor during the current term of the Adityanath-led government. The excise policy of the Delhi government for 2021-22 was criticized and is under investigation by both the CBI and the ED for alleged irregularities. Agarwal emphasized that the UP excise department operates differently, offering a level-playing field for everyone and focusing on transparency. The revenue from the excise department has substantially increased under the Adityanath government's tenure, rising from Rs 14,000 crore to Rs 42,000 crore, and the target is to reach Rs 50,000 crore in the current financial year. Agarwal also highlighted the growth in the number of distilleries and ethanol production in UP. He emphasized that the state prioritizes the safety of its liquor production to prevent deaths caused by spurious liquor.

item.title: Lok Sabha polls: SBSP seeks to contest five seats in UP, Bihar; party chief dismisses INDIA bloc threat
item.description: The Chief of Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP), Om Prakash Rajbhar, has stated that his party is prepared for the upcoming Lok Sabha polls and has requested five seats from the BJP, their alliance partner, for the general elections. Rajbhar also mentioned that the opposition India bloc does not pose a challenge to the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) as the constituent parties within the opposition fight among themselves. In response to Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's statement on contesting in 65 out of 80 Lok Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh, Rajbhar claimed that Yadav wants Narendra Modi to become the prime minister again, as the Congress becoming strong in Uttar Pradesh would weaken the Samajwadi Party. Rajbhar criticized Yadav's PDA (Pichhda, Dalit, Alpsankhyak) strategy, stating that the Samajwadi Party only benefits the Yadavs and not the backward classes. SBSP won six seats in the 2022 assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh in an alliance with the Samajwadi Party and later formally joined the NDA. Rajbhar dismissed the threat of the opposition India bloc, describing it as not a challenge and citing Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's controversial comments in the assembly on women. SBSP, with a significant presence among the OBC Rajbhar caste, aims to contest a few parliamentary seats in eastern Uttar Pradesh and contiguous areas of Bihar. Regarding seat-sharing for the 2024 elections, Rajbhar stated that the SBSP has sought three seats in Uttar Pradesh and two in Bihar from the BJP. Although discussions on seat-sharing are yet to be held, the party is laying groundwork in Bihar. Rajbhar did not disclose the specific seats his party has requested. The SBSP was previously in an alliance with the BJP in the 2017 assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh and won four seats, and Rajbhar served as a minister during Yogi Adityanath's first term. After formally rejoining the NDA in July, there is speculation about Rajbhar's return to the cabinet and the induction of another OBC leader, Dara Singh Chauhan.

item.title: Paresh Rawal shares update about ‘Welcome 3’ and ‘Hera Pheri 3’
item.description: Actor Paresh Rawal is excited to return to the popular franchises "Hera Pheri" and "Welcome" as he prepares to film the third installments of both series. Rawal believes that creating a new part for a beloved franchise is a challenging task, but is confident in the success of these films. He cited the "Munna Bhai" franchise as an example of how to create a successful franchise by offering something different with each film. Rawal revealed that filming for "Welcome 3" will start in December and will be released next year, while "Hera Pheri 3" will also be happening soon. Rawal's latest film, "Shastry Virudh Shastry," is a story about a boy caught between the emotions and conflicts of his parents and grandparents. The film explores themes of love, family, and the judiciary system. Produced by Viacom18 Studios, the film was released earlier this month.

item.title: Felt like a ‘third-wheel’ in England changing room, Willey says retirement decision final
item.description: David Willey, the English cricketer, has announced his retirement after feeling like a "third wheel" in the England cricket team's changing room due to not having a central contract. Despite performing well and taking three wickets against Pakistan, Willey was denied a central contract for the upcoming season. He expressed his confidence in his decision to retire from international cricket, stating that he doesn't want to feel like an outsider again. Willey believed he still had the ability to play in the T20 World Cup but cited the toll of not knowing where he stood with the team as a reason for his retirement. Despite his disappointment, he cherished the opportunity to enjoy his last game for England and thanked his teammates for their support.

item.title: Andhra Pradesh Guv, CM extend Diwali greetings
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Andhra Pradesh Governor, S Abdul Nazeer, and Chief Minister Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy extended Diwali greetings to the people of the state. The Governor expressed his wishes for peace, prosperity, and happiness during the festival of lights. He highlighted that Diwali symbolizes the triumph of light over darkness, good over evil, and knowledge over ignorance, emphasizing the festivity's ability to inspire and promote harmony in society. Similarly, the Chief Minister conveyed his festival greetings on a social media platform, emphasizing the significance of Diwali as a celebration of light's victory over darkness, good over evil, and wisdom over ignorance.

item.title: Enough with Diwali sensory overload—introverts like me want food, films, fairy lights
item.description: The article discusses the author's desire to have a low-key and solitary celebration during the festive season. They express their preference for watching movies, particularly the director's cut of The Lord of the Rings, and mention some recent films and short films they would like to watch. The author also mentions the joy of being in control of their own plans and the superficial nature of group chats during festivals. They express their intention to watch fireworks from their balcony and potentially take selfies for dating apps and Instagram.

item.title: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf blames PDM government for ‘economic catastrophe’
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) has released a white paper blaming the Pakistan Democratic Movement (PDM) coalition government for the economic crisis in Pakistan, according to a report by Dawn. The PTI claims that despite the COVID-19 pandemic, their government managed to put the economy on a path of rapid growth. The white paper argues that the PDM government, which came into power through a regime change conspiracy, reversed the economic gains achieved by the PTI-led government and caused more economic damage than natural disasters and the pandemic combined. The white paper highlights that when the PTI took office in 2018, the economy was on the verge of collapse, with various economic indicators such as an overvalued Pakistani rupee and a high current account deficit. The document also criticizes the previous government's mismanagement of the energy sector, particularly in relation to the overbuilding of power supply through imported fuel plants. The white paper states that the PTI government had to approach the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for assistance, which came with tough conditions such as increasing taxes and tariffs. Despite facing a global commodity super cycle that led to higher prices for petroleum products, edible oil, and coal, the PTI government was able to maintain control over inflation rates. The white paper also emphasizes that the PTI government accumulated additional debt compared to the previous government, largely due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. In related news, the PTI has canceled its public gathering in Karachi after the district administration denied permission. The PTI described the attitude of the authorities towards the party as unfair and stated that they were being denied a level-playing field.

item.title: Jordan airdrops humanitarian aid to field hospital in Gaza Strip
item.description: The Jordan Air Force has dropped humanitarian aid to a field hospital in the Gaza Strip, operated by Amman, to assist Gazan civilians amid the ongoing crisis. This is the second operation by Jordan in recent weeks, with packages being dropped from planes along with parachutes. Earlier this week, Jordan also airdropped medical aid into Gaza, bypassing Israel's tight embargo on aid entering the Strip. The move was coordinated with the US and Israel. However, Israel insists on inspecting all aid entering the Strip due to concerns about weapons smuggling. Gazans and rights groups have criticized the amount and pace of aid reaching the Strip as insufficient. Three babies died in a neonatal unit in northern Gaza after the hospital went "out of service" due to continuous Israeli fire in the vicinity. The hospital is currently treating 36 babies and providing shelter for around 20,000 displaced people.

item.title: Cricket-England’s poor World Cup doesn’t mean ‘huge clear-out,’ says skipper Buttler
item.description: England's one-day international cricket team will not undergo major changes despite their poor performance in the World Cup, according to captain Jos Buttler. The team finished their campaign with a convincing win over Pakistan, securing a place in the 2025 Champions Trophy. Buttler stated that there will not be a drastic change in playing style, but rather a push forward. White-ball coach Matthew Mott expressed confidence in keeping his job and backed Buttler to continue as captain, despite his own lack of strong performances.

item.title: Dubai’s gold king Joy Alukkas started his rise with a revenge plan
item.description: The article tells a story of betrayal and determination in the business world. It starts with an advertisement aimed at undermining the author's gold business in Abu Dhabi. They discover that their advisor and mentor, George Varghese, was behind it, leading to feelings of hurt and anger. Instead of confronting Varghese directly, the author decides to open a store in the same building as his mentor's, turning the tables on him. The author strategically chooses a prime location in the Gold Souk of Dubai, ensuring maximum visibility for their store. Despite facing challenges with regulations, the author successfully opens the new store, which becomes a testament to their instinct for ideal locations.

item.title: Israel offers to evacuate babies from main Gaza hospital amid fierce fighting
item.description: Israel's military is prepared to evacuate babies from Gaza's largest hospital after fuel ran out amid intense fighting in the area. Palestinian officials reported that two newborns have died and dozens more are at risk. The Rafah crossing into Egypt will reopen on Sunday for foreign passport holders after closing on Friday. Hamas claims to have destroyed over 160 Israeli military targets in Gaza, including more than 25 vehicles in the past 48 hours. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the deaths of five more Israeli soldiers in Gaza, bringing the total to 46 since ground operations began. Israel said rockets were still being fired from Gaza into southern Israel, where it claims that about 1,200 people were killed and more than 200 taken hostage by Hamas last month. Palestinian officials said that 11,078 Gaza residents had been killed in air and artillery strikes since October 7th, with around 40% of them being children. Israel's three major TV news channels reported progress towards a deal to free hostages held by Hamas in Gaza. The deal would involve releasing women and minor Palestinian prisoners and considering letting fuel into Gaza while reserving the right to resume fighting.

item.title: 15-year-old boy, held with brown sugar, sent to special home for 3 yrs
item.description: A 15-year-old boy in Bhubaneswar has been sentenced to three years in a special home after being caught with 1.26 kg of brown sugar. The Juvenile Justice Board found him guilty under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, 1985 and ordered the home to provide reformative services during his stay, including education, skill development, counseling, behavior modification therapy, psychiatric support, and treatment. The boy was apprehended by the Special Task Force of the state police on August 12, 2021, along with three others near the Khurdha Bus Stand. The trial is ongoing for the adult co-accused.

item.title: Kohli’s 50th ton is a big worry for fans. King’s focused on cup, not the crown
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The article discusses the burden of expectations and individual records carried by cricket players Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. It questions the notion that they prioritized personal milestones over the team's success, suggesting that this accusation arises only when they approach a century. The article argues that intent cannot be judged based on a player's stroke play from 80 to 100, just as a bowler shouldn't be faulted for leaking runs in search of a wicket. The obsession with records in cricket is highlighted, with numerous examples mentioned, including Tendulkar's records. It emphasizes that Kohli understands the fans' obsession but states that breaking records isn't what truly drives his cricket. The article also addresses the criticism faced by players who are deemed good enough only for quick innings and argues that match situations and team requirements take precedence over personal milestones. It concludes by suggesting that individual records can coexist with team victories and questions whether fans can accept a Kohli century in a World Cup final loss.

item.title: Man held for UP for murder of person in Maharashtra
item.description: A 40-year-old man from Jaunpur, Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly killing a 19-year-old person in Thane, Maharashtra. The victim's body was found on November 8, and the police launched an investigation into the murder. Through CCTV footage and intelligence inputs, the victim was identified and it was discovered that the accused was angry because the victim had helped his third wife leave him. The accused also intended to kill his wife, who was in Pratapgarh, Uttar Pradesh. The police traced the accused to a village in Jaunpur district and arrested him with the assistance of the local police. The accused has a history of criminal offenses, including theft and assault.

item.title: Soccer-Gotham defeat Reign for first NWSL title, Rapinoe exits early
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Spanish striker Esther Gonzalez scored the winning goal for Gotham FC, securing their first National Women's Soccer League championship title with a 2-1 victory over OL Reign. The match also marked the final career game for veteran Megan Rapinoe, who unfortunately exited early due to injury. Lynn Williams opened the scoring for Gotham, while Rose Lavelle found the net for Reign. After numerous missed opportunities and drama in the final moments of the game, Gonzalez's header in stoppage time sealed the victory for Gotham.

item.title: Navi Mumbai cops register case against 8 including ex-minister for APMC mismanagement
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Navi Mumbai police have registered a case against eight individuals, including a former Maharashtra minister, for allegedly mismanaging an Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) and causing a loss of Rs 7.61 crore to the state exchequer. The case involves the alleged favoring of certain organizations in awarding contracts for the construction of toilets in areas under the APMC's control. The accused violated regulations between 2005 and 2022, resulting in the financial loss. The FIR registered by the police includes charges under various sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Prevention of Corruption Act.

item.title: As fighting rages, Israel says ready to evacuate babies from Gaza’s main hospital
item.description: Israel's military is prepared to evacuate babies from Gaza's largest hospital as fuel runs out and the humanitarian situation worsens. The Rafah crossing into Egypt will reopen for foreign passport holders after closing on Friday. Hamas claims to have destroyed over 160 Israeli military targets, while the Israeli military announces the deaths of five more soldiers in Gaza. Reports suggest progress towards a possible deal to release hostages held by Hamas. In Tel Aviv, a rally supports hostage families. Al Shifa hospital in Gaza suspends operations due to fuel shortage, resulting in the deaths of two newborns. Israel denies siege or shooting at the hospital but agrees to help evacuate infants from there. The conflict continues with ongoing clashes and continuous bombardment. Muslim and Arab countries call for an immediate end to military operations in Gaza. Pro-Palestinian rallies take place in London and Brussels.

item.title: Security beefed up across West Bengal in view of Kali Puja, Diwali
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Security was tightened across West Bengal in preparation for Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations. In Kolkata, over 5,000 police personnel were deployed to maintain law and order and monitor illegal firecrackers. Similar security measures were taken in other major cities of the state. Fire and emergency services were on standby, and hospitals were prepared for any emergencies.Security was tightened across West Bengal in preparation for Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations. In Kolkata, over 5,000 police personnel were deployed to maintain law and order and monitor illegal firecrackers. Similar security measures were taken in other major cities of the state. Fire and emergency services were on standby, and hospitals were prepared for any emergencies.

item.title: Arab and Muslim leaders demand immediate end to Gaza war
item.description: Saudi Arabia and other Muslim countries have called for an immediate end to military operations in Gaza, rejecting Israel's justification of its actions against Palestinians as self-defense. The joint Islamic-Arab summit in Riyadh urged the International Criminal Court to investigate "war crimes and crimes against humanity that Israel is committing" in the Palestinian territories. Saudi Arabia has sought to press the United States and Israel for an end to hostilities in Gaza, and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman gathered Arab and Muslim leaders to reinforce that message. Leaders including Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi, Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan, Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, and Syrian President Bashar al-Assad attended the summit. The summit demanded an end to the siege of Gaza, access for humanitarian aid, and a halt to the sale of arms to Israel.

item.title: Police investigate ‘cyber incident’ at Australia ports operator
item.description: Australian police are investigating a cybersecurity incident that caused ports operator DP World Australia to suspend operations at ports in several states. The breach was detected on Friday, leading to the suspension of container terminals in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, and Fremantle. DP World Australia is currently testing key systems and examining the nature of data access and theft. The company has not provided a timeline for when normal operations will resume. The interruption is expected to impact the movement of goods into and out of the country for several days. The government is coordinating a response to the incident, and DP World employs over 7,000 people in the Asia-Pacific region, with ports and terminals in 18 locations.

item.title: Telangana assembly polls: Some families ‘more equal than others’ for political parties, given 2 tickets
item.description: The article discusses the presence of family members in the Telangana Assembly election. It highlights how members from the same family, such as siblings or spouses, are contesting from different parties. Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and his son K T Rama Rao are both seeking re-election. The Congress party has also fielded candidates who are related to each other, including a husband and wife and two brothers. The article mentions criticism from the opposition party regarding the Congress party's violation of its "one family, one ticket" resolution. The presence of dynastic politics is acknowledged, with advantages such as branding, family vote banks, and financial influence mentioned. The article concludes by emphasizing the responsibility of intellectuals and educated voters to inform the public about the negative aspects of such politics.

item.title: Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan exude desi vibes at Diwali celebration
item.description: Bollywood celebrities Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan hosted a lavish Diwali party for their close friends and family members. Kareena shared her stunning Diwali look on Instagram, wearing a red embellished saree with floral prints and a matching strappy blouse. Her makeup was dewy, and she accessorized with diamond-studded earrings and a bindi. Saif looked stylish in a black and white dhoti kurta set. The couple also shared pictures of themselves with their sons Taimur and Jeh, decorating their home for the festival. The star-studded party was attended by Sara Ali Khan, Ibrahim Ali Khan, Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor, Karisma Kapoor, and Neetu Singh. On the work front, Kareena's film 'The Buckingham Murders' premiered at the BFI London Film Festival, and Saif will be seen in the Pan-India film 'Devara' with Jr NTR and Janhvi Kapoor.

item.title: Ranbir, Alia arrive hand-in-hand at Kareena Kapoor Khan’s Diwali bash
item.description: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt attended Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan's Diwali bash in Mumbai. Alia looked stunning in a red lehenga, while Ranbir wore a black kurta with a black jacket and white pants. They posed for photos together, holding hands. Ranbir's mother Neetu Kapoor also attended the party wearing a pink salwar suit. Other celebrities like Arjun Kapoor, Amrita Arora, Karisma Kapoor, Kunal Kemmu, and Soha Ali Khan were also seen arriving at the event. Kareena and Saif were dressed elegantly, with Kareena sharing a stylish picture of the couple on Instagram. Before the party, Kareena shared pictures of her sons, Taimur and Jeh, creating a rangoli. Kareena recently premiered her film 'The Buckingham Murders' at the BFI London Film Festival, and Saif will be seen in the Pan-India film 'Devara.'

item.title: Pandian true disciple of Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, says top BJD leader
item.description: Former bureaucrat VK Pandian, who recently retired from government service, has been described as a "true disciple" of Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik by a top leader of the ruling BJD party in Odisha. Pandian, who served as Patnaik's private secretary, has been appointed as the chairman of the 'Nabin Odisha' program and the '5T' transformational initiatives. He has also been given the status of a cabinet minister and will report directly to the chief minister. The BJD party is reportedly waiting for Patnaik's final word to officially induct Pandian into the party.

item.title: Anti-terrorism court extends judicial remand of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf leader Yasmin Rashid and others
item.description: The anti-terrorism court in Islamabad, Pakistan has extended the judicial remand of three accused individuals, including PTI leader Yasmin Rashid, in a case related to vandalism. The court ordered a 14-day extension and scheduled their next presentation for November 25. The case revolves around the arson of the Shadman Town police station. These individuals were initially sent to jail on a 13-day judicial remand after protests erupted following the arrest of PTI chairman Imran Khan on May 9. Imran Khan was later released, but many PTI workers and leaders were rounded up and are still facing court proceedings. It is important to note that Imran Khan's arrest took place on August 5, following his sentencing in the Toshakhana case, resulting in his disqualification from politics for five years.

item.title: Taliban-led Ministry of Refugees and Repatriation calls Pak’s move to deport Afghan migrants “rushed”
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Pakistan's decision to deport Afghan immigrants has been criticized by Mohammad Arsalan Kharoti, Deputy Minister of Refugees and Repatriation in Afghanistan. Kharoti called the decision rushed and a violation of international laws. He also highlighted that in the past two weeks, around 300,000 Afghan refugees have returned to Kabul from neighboring countries, particularly Pakistan. Kharoti emphasized the need for more assistance to be provided to the returning immigrants. Balochistan caretaker information minister Jan Achakzai also stated that their government would continue the campaign against illegal immigrants.

The final match was expected to be Megan Rapinoe's retirement party, but she was forced to leave the game early due to an injury. Rose Lavelle scored for Reign, but they were unable to equalize in the second half.

item.title: Former UK PM Johnson condemns ‘anti-Semitic rally’ in London
item.description: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson condemned the anti-Semitic rally in London and the Hamas massacre, stating that they will not succeed in wiping Israel off the map. He expressed shock at the anti-Semitic chants and called for more action to combat rising hatred in Europe. The protest, organized to denounce Israeli aggression in Gaza, drew thousands of people and was anticipated to be one of Britain's largest-ever protests. The Metropolitan Police mobilized a large number of officers to ensure safety and prevent any disruptions. The protest became embroiled in a political debate over whether it should take place. Counterprotesters confronted the police and threw missiles as they moved towards other parts of the city.

item.title: Hamas integral part of axis of terrorism led by Iran: Israeli PM Netanyahu
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has referred to Hamas as an integral part of the axis of terrorism led by Iran, stating that it endangers the Middle East and the Arab world. Netanyahu called on Arab leaders to take a stand against Hamas and criticized the group for bringing disaster to Gaza over the past 16 years. He affirmed that international pressure will not change Israel's determination to defend itself. Netanyahu declared that Israel's war against Hamas is advancing with the goal of victory, vowing to eliminate Hamas and bring back hostages. He stated that thousands of Hamas terrorists, including senior commanders, have been killed. Netanyahu emphasized that the return of hostages is the main objective of the conflict and that there will be no ceasefire without their release. The Israeli Defense Forces also launched airstrikes on Hezbollah infrastructure and military posts in Lebanon in response to previous attacks.

item.title: Soccer-New coach Talay sees room to improve on Sydney’s five-goal haul
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Ufuk Talay, the new coach of Sydney FC, emphasized that there is still room for improvement despite their 5-1 victory over Adelaide United in his first game in charge. Talay took over from Steve Corica after Sydney had lost their first three games of the season. He was pleased with the team's performance but acknowledged that there is still work to be done. Talay believes that the international break will provide an opportunity to make further changes and prepare for their upcoming match against Western Sydney Wanderers.

item.title: China’s Singles Day sales festival wraps up with e-commerce giants reporting sales growth
item.description: Alibaba's Chinese e-commerce platforms, Tmall and Taobao, experienced positive growth during this year's Singles Day sales period. Competitor JD.com also reported a record high in gross merchandising volume (GMV) during the sales period. The Singles Day festival, originally a 24-hour online shopping event, has expanded into weeks of promotions across major e-commerce platforms and physical stores in China. Alibaba did not disclose the actual yuan value of its sales for the second consecutive year. The festival is seen as a measure of consumer confidence, and expectations for sales growth this year were subdued due to economic challenges. Alibaba pressured merchants to offer low prices for Singles Day to compete with rivals such as Douyin and Pinduoduo. A Bain and Company report found that consumers planned to spend less or the same compared to last year. Shoppers focused on purchasing necessities rather than discretionary items. The final sales picture and growth rates will take longer to emerge, as return rates are expected to be high this year.

item.title: Four killed in building collapse in China’s Wenzhou city
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Four construction workers were killed when a building collapsed during renovation in Wenzhou city, China. The incident was attributed to continuous rain that hindered rescue efforts. Investigations are ongoing to determine the cause of the collapse. This incident is one of several similar accidents in recent months, including the collapse of a gym in Heilongjiang province that resulted in three fatalities. Authorities suspect the illegal stacking of construction materials on the gym's roof may have caused the collapse. These incidents have prompted concerns about building safety, with social media users calling for greater attention to be given to hidden dangers.

item.title: Delhi may see best Diwali day air quality in 8 years if firecracker ban works
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Delhi experienced its best air quality on Diwali day in eight years due to a strict ban on firecrackers and favorable weather conditions. The city woke up to clear skies and an Air Quality Index (AQI) of 202, the best in at least three weeks. The AQI between zero and 50 is considered 'good', while 201 and 300 are considered 'poor'. The improvement in air quality can be attributed to intermittent rainfall and wind speed that helped disperse pollutants. Last year, Delhi recorded an AQI of 312 on Diwali day. However, sporadic incidents of firecracker burning were reported despite the ban, which could lead to a rise in pollution levels.

item.title: Spain’s Sanchez wins support for PM bid amid anger over Catalan amnesty vow
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Spain's acting Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is likely to secure another term in office with the backing of regional parties, including the National Basque Party (PNV), the Canaries' coalition, and the Catalan separatist party Junts. This support would give Sanchez an absolute majority in the lower house. However, there is widespread anger over Sanchez's pledge of amnesty for Catalan separatists, with opinion polls showing the country divided on the issue. The proposed amnesty law would release civil servants involved in the illegal independence referendum in Catalonia in 2017 and allow separatist leaders, like Carles Puigdemont, to run for office again. Critics argue that the amnesty undermines the rule of law, while tensions have led to violent clashes between protesters and police.

item.title: How Centre’s ‘Aaina’ portal could help 4,700+ urban local bodies take long, hard look in the mirror
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) in India is launching a new initiative called "Aaina" (mirror), which aims to consolidate information on over 4,700 urban local bodies (ULBs) onto a single portal. The initiative is intended to help ULBs understand their current status and improve their performance and service delivery. The portal will provide data across domains such as planning and finance, allowing ULBs to learn from each other's work. Under the initiative, ULBs will be asked to provide data on five categories: planning, municipal finance, citizen-centric services, administrative structure, and basic service delivery. The new platform will also standardize data collection, as ULBs currently have different methods of collating data. The initiative is expected to aid in planning future schemes and serve as a knowledge-sharing platform for ULBs to improve their functioning.

item.title: MP: Migration for employment continues in tribal-dominated Jhabua; BJP and Congress pass the blame
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Migration for employment opportunities is a significant issue in the Jhabua assembly constituency in Madhya Pradesh. Many residents, like Ran Singh, migrate to Gujarat in search of work because the rocky land in Jhabua does not yield sufficient crops. Singh himself had worked as a cotton-picker in Gujarat in the past. The upcoming state assembly elections in Jhabua, a Congress stronghold reserved for scheduled tribes, have not generated much election atmosphere. The incumbent Congress candidate is Vikrant Bhuria, while the Bharatiya Janata Party has fielded Bhanu Bhuria as their candidate. Vikrant claims that the BJP government has not done enough to increase employment opportunities in the tribal-dominated region, leading to migration. Bhanu Bhuria alleges that the lack of dams in Jhabua, which could have provided water for irrigation, has contributed to the migration issue. In the 2018 assembly elections, Guman Singh Damor of the BJP defeated Vikrant Bhuria, but subsequently resigned for the Lok Sabha seat. Kantilal Bhuria, another Congress candidate, won the by-election for the Jhabua assembly seat.

item.title: Arab countries oppose measures against Israel despite fighting in Gaza
item.description: An emergency meeting of the Arab League and the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation was held in Riyadh to discuss Israel's invasion of Gaza. However, no practical measures were adopted against Israel. Discussions focused on stopping Israeli air traffic over the Gulf, preventing the US Air Force from delivering arms to Israel through Gulf air force bases, and cutting back oil sales to the US due to its support for Israel. Some Arab countries demanded that moderate Arab states suspend their economic relations with Israel, but a resolution to adopt these measures was blocked by Israel's Abraham accords partner states. Egypt, Jordan, the UAE, Bahrain, Sudan, and Morocco voted against the measures, along with Saudi Arabia, Mauritania, and Djibouti. The meeting also rejected an Iranian demand to designate the Israel Defense Forces as a terror organization.

item.title: French national Michel Morliere dies at Apnaghar Ashram in Varanasi
item.description: A French national named Michel Morliere has passed away at Apnaghar Ashram in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh. The French Embassy in India has given permission for individuals named Gopal Jha, Emeline Jamont, and Aman to collect the deceased's body and related documents, including death certificates, on its behalf. The embassy has also allowed them to cremate the body and hand over the ashes to Emeline Jamond, as per the wishes of the deceased's family. The embassy expresses gratitude to the authorities for their assistance in this matter.

item.title: Netanyahu rules out Palestinian authority’s return to Gaza
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has stated that the Palestinian Authority (PA) will not be permitted to return to Gaza following the war. He emphasized the importance of total security control to eliminate potential terrorists and prevent the teaching of hatred towards Israel. Netanyahu also criticized the PA's leader for his delayed condemnation of a massacre. In 2007, Hamas, backed by Iran, forcefully took over the Gaza Strip, resulting in the expulsion, imprisonment, or death of Fatah members.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has ruled out the return of the Palestinian Authority (PA) to Gaza after the war. The Gaza Strip has been under the control of the Iran-backed Hamas since 2007, with members of rival Fatah either killed, imprisoned, or expelled.

The hospital staff has requested assistance in transferring babies to a safer hospital, which the IDF has agreed to provide. However, three babies in the neonatal unit of Al-Shifa Hospital died after the hospital went "out of service" due to continuous Israeli fire. The hospital is reportedly surrounded, and doctors are now manually providing artificial respiration to 36 babies. The Hamas-run Ministry of Health estimates that there are around 400 people being treated at the hospital, with 20,000 displaced seeking shelter there. The hospital's intensive care unit, pediatric department, and oxygen devices have stopped working. In response to attacks, IDF fighter jets targeted Hezbollah infrastructure and military posts in Lebanon. The IDF also struck a Hezbollah terrorist cell and launch pad after rockets were launched from Lebanon towards northern Israel.

item.title: Over 800 Sudanese reportedly killed by armed groups in West Darfur: UNHCR
item.description: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) has reported that over 800 people have been killed and more than 4.8 million people displaced in the past six months due to armed insurgency in Ardamata, Sudan's West Darfur region. The UN warns that the escalating violence in Darfur raises concerns of a repeat of the atrocities committed two decades ago. The conflict has resulted in the destruction of close to 100 shelters and extensive looting, including UNHCR relief items. In the past, thousands were killed and millions displaced during fighting between government forces and rebel groups in Darfur. The UN Special Adviser on the Prevention of Genocide has warned that continued fighting, including attacks based on ethnicity, could amount to war crimes and crimes against humanity. The UN refugee agency expresses alarm over reports of sexual violence, torture, arbitrary killings, extortion, and targeting of specific ethnic groups. UN High Commissioner for Refugees, Filippo Grandi, urges an immediate end to the fighting and respect for civilians to avoid another catastrophe. Since mid-April, over 4.8 million people have been displaced within Sudan, with an additional 1.2 million seeking refuge in neighboring countries. Over 8,000 people have fled to Chad in the last week alone, according to UNHCR.

item.title: French Ambassador to India visits war veterans’ memorial
item.description: French Ambassador to India, Thierry Mathou, and France's Deputy Ambassador to Puducherry, Talbot Barre, visited the war veterans' memorial in Puducherry on November 11, to commemorate the end of World War I. They paid tribute to the soldiers who lost their lives by placing a wreath at the memorial and observing a moment of silence. The memorial is dedicated to residents of French India who died during the war. Additionally, India and France have committed to deepening their cooperation in areas such as digital public infrastructure, cybersecurity, start-ups, AI, supercomputing, and digital skills development. They aim to harness their respective strengths in digital technologies and work together for a peaceful and open cyberspace. The two countries also recognize the potential of startups in driving innovation and economic growth and emphasize their commitment to bilateral cooperation.

item.title: Satisfaction level of Afghan women for their freedom, social life lowest in world: Survey
item.description: According to a recent survey by the Gallup Institute, Afghan women have the lowest satisfaction level for their freedom and social life compared to other countries. Only 11% of Afghan women are satisfied with their social freedom in Afghanistan, while 17% said they are treated with respect. The survey highlights that women in Afghanistan continue to face suffering despite some level of freedom. The Taliban, however, dismissed the survey as invalid and claimed that the suffering of Afghan women has ended. The report also expresses concern about the deportation of Afghan refugees from Pakistan and the pressure it puts on the lives of deported women and girls.

item.title: Soccer-Juventus move top of Serie A with 2-1 win over Cagliari
item.description: Juventus secured a 2-1 victory over Cagliari, moving them to the top of Serie A with 29 points. Gleison Bremer and Daniele Rugani scored in the second half to secure Juventus' fifth consecutive win. Coach Massimiliano Allegri praised his team's spirit and emphasized the need for improved effectiveness in the final pass. After six clean sheets, Juventus conceded their first goal since September. Despite the victory, Allegri considers Inter Milan as favorites for the Scudetto, with AC Milan and Napoli close behind. The next game for Juventus is a top-of-the-table clash against Inter after the international break. Cagliari, who recently climbed out of the relegation zone, currently sit in 17th place with nine points.

item.title: Trump backs requests for TV coverage of his federal criminal trial – court filing
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump has filed a legal motion supporting media requests for live television coverage of his federal trial. Trump argues that prosecutors want the trial held in darkness as part of a politically motivated effort by President Joe Biden's administration to undermine his bid for re-election in 2024. Trump is facing four criminal proceedings, including charges of attempting to defraud the federal government and obstructing Congress by spreading false claims of election fraud. The latest filing by Trump's lawyers endorses media organizations' requests for live television coverage, stating that it would allow the American public to see that the case is a "dreamt-up constitutional charade." Special prosecutor Jack Smith had previously opposed the media requests, citing a federal court rule that prohibits broadcasts of criminal proceedings.

item.title: Heavy rains flood homes and crops in northern France
item.description: Days of heavy rains in northern France have caused rivers to overflow, leading to flooding of houses and fields. Residents have been evacuated, with some having to be airlifted to safety. More than 100 towns are on red alert and around 200 schools in the region have been closed. Rescue workers have also had to evacuate cattle. Farmers have suffered significant losses, with poultry farms flooded and crops compromised, raising concerns about the spread of disease. The situation is being considered a natural disaster, which allows affected individuals to benefit from insurance coverage.

item.title: Wegovy’s heart benefits due to more than weight loss, Novo says
item.description: Novo Nordisk has announced new data that suggests the heart protective benefits of its obesity treatment, Wegovy, are not solely due to weight loss. The drug, which has been shown to help patients lose an average of 15% of their weight, also reduces the risk of heart attack, stroke, or death from heart disease by 20%, according to early data from the company's select trial. The study found that the cardiovascular benefits of Wegovy appeared almost immediately after starting treatment, suggesting they were not solely a result of weight loss. The drug also demonstrated a reduction in non-fatal heart attack, non-fatal stroke, and heart-related death. The study's authors note that while the mechanisms behind Wegovy's cardiovascular protection remain speculative, it has a consistent effect on associated risk factors such as inflammation, blood pressure, and blood sugar control. However, the trial did report adverse side effects, primarily gastrointestinal disorders like nausea and vomiting, in almost 1,500 patients taking Wegovy compared to 718 patients in the placebo group. Novo Nordisk expects to have Wegovy's label updated to include the heart benefits in the U.S. and EU next year.

item.title: Taliban criticises Pakistan’s decision to deport Afghan immigrants from country
item.description: Pakistan's decision to deport Afghan immigrants has been criticized by Mohammad Arsala Kharoti, the Taliban-appointed deputy of Afghanistan's Ministry of Refugees and Repatriation. Kharoti stated that the decision was rushed and violated the rights of immigrants, calling on Pakistan to allow them to return voluntarily. He highlighted that approximately 300,000 Afghan refugees had returned to Kabul from neighboring countries, particularly Pakistan, in the past two weeks. Kharoti emphasized that more assistance should be provided to these returnees, as current support from the international community and organizations is insufficient. Additionally, Jan Achakzai, Balochistan's caretaker information minister, claimed that the Pakistani government would take similar actions against those residing without legal documents in the country.

item.title: US accomplice in Israel ‘crimes’: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi
item.description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi accused the US government of being the "main perpetrator" and "accomplice" in the conflict between Israel and Hamas. He criticized the US for supporting Israel and providing it with weapons, claiming that Israel has dropped bombs equivalent to seven atomic bombs in Gaza. Raisi made these remarks at the Arab Islamic Summit in Riyadh, where he called on attendees to "save the Palestinians." This summit was hosted by Saudi Arabia in response to the ongoing situation in Gaza. This marks the first visit by an Iranian leader to Saudi Arabia in 11 years, following the restoration of diplomatic relations between the two countries in March.

item.title: BSF jawans celebrate Diwali with Seema Jan Kalyan Samiti in Arnia

The troops gathered at Vikram post in Arnia to light diyas and candles and offer flowers to Mata Lakshmi. The SJKS member expressed gratitude towards the jawans for their border guarding duties which allow people to celebrate Diwali safely at home. In a fit of rage, he repeatedly struck her on the head with a pressure cooker, resulting in her immediate death. Patali is currently on the run, and a murder case has been registered against him based on a complaint from Meena Devi's brother. Efforts are being made to apprehend Patali, while Meena Devi's body has been sent for post-mortem examination.

item.title: J’khand: Two die as train stops suddenly after overhead electric wire snaps
item.description: Two passengers died after a Delhi-bound train in Jharkhand's Koderma district came to a sudden halt due to an overhead electric wire snapping. The incident occurred between Gomoh and Koderma railway stations when the driver of the Purushottam Express applied the emergency brake. As a result, two people were killed due to the jolt caused by the sudden stop. The train was traveling at a speed of 130 kmph at the time of the accident. Train services resumed after a four-hour delay. The Purushottam Express was taken to Gomoh by a diesel engine and then sent to Delhi using an electric engine. The railway division manager and other officials visited the accident site.

Arthur emphasizes the need to create a stable environment for the team and ignore outside noise. He also mentions that the absence of fast bowler Naseem Shah had upset the team's equilibrium. Despite the challenges, Arthur remains committed to his role as coach and expresses his love for Pakistani cricket and his desire to provide stability and structure for the players.

item.title: Vigilance minister initiates inquiry against Delhi chief secretary in Bamnoli land acquisition case
item.description: Delhi Vigilance Minister Atishi has initiated an inquiry into a complaint against Chief Secretary Naresh Kumar regarding the acquisition of land in Bamnoli village for the Dwarka Expressway. The complaint alleges that the chief secretary's son was employed by a relative of a landowner who received enhanced compensation for the acquired land. Atishi has summoned all the files on the land acquisition and has directed the divisional commissioner and vigilance director to provide them by 7 pm on Saturday. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is already probing the matter, but Atishi has insisted on conducting her own inquiry. The chief secretary has called the complaint an act of "mudslinging" by disgruntled individuals. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has marked the complaint for an inquiry and requested a detailed report from the vigilance minister.

item.title: Dhami buys earthen lamps from Kumhar Mandi for Diwali, urges people to buy local products

Olivier Giroud scored for Milan before getting sent off in stoppage time. Milan now sits third in the standings, five points behind leaders Inter Milan and three points behind second-placed Juventus. They could drop to fourth if Napoli, who are on 21 points, win their match against Empoli. This draw comes after Milan's win against Paris St Germain in the Champions League, which was their only victory in all competitions since early October. Lecce, who had only gathered two points from their previous six Serie A games, are currently in 14th place in the standings.

item.title: Soccer-Arsenal outclass Burnley in the end
item.description: Arsenal defeated Burnley 3-1 in a home match, securing their sixth straight defeat in all competitions. The win allowed Arsenal to move up to second place in the Premier League table, tied in points with leaders Manchester City. Despite encountering resistance from Burnley in the first half, Arsenal took the lead just before halftime with a goal from Leandro Trossard. Burnley equalized in the second half with a deflected goal from Josh Brownhill, but Arsenal quickly regained the lead with a goal from William Saliba. Oleksandr Zinchenko extended Arsenal's lead to 3-1 with an improvised volley. However, the match ended on a sour note for Arsenal as Fabio Vieira was sent off for a high boot challenge on Brownhill's knee.

item.title: Soccer-Lindelof scores as Man Utd beat Luton 1-0 for second successive league win
item.description: Manchester United secured a much-needed victory with a 1-0 win over Luton Town in the Premier League. Victor Lindelof scored the only goal of the game in the second half, breaking the deadlock in the 59th minute. This win came as a relief for Manchester United, who have been struggling recently, losing nine out of their last 18 games and facing elimination from the League Cup. Luton Town, on the other hand, have had a challenging start to their debut season in the top flight, with just one league victory so far.

item.title: Goa Archbishop extends greetings on Diwali
item.description: Archbishop of Goa and Daman, Filipe Neri Cardinal Ferrao, extended warm greetings and wishes to the people on the occasion of Diwali, the festival of lights. He emphasized that the festival symbolizes the victory of good over evil and promotes harmony and peace. The archbishop expressed hope that this festival would inspire future generations to spread love, truth, harmony, and freedom in society.Archbishop Filipe Neri Cardinal Ferrao of Goa and Daman extended warm greetings to the people on the occasion of Diwali, the festival of lights. He expressed his wishes for a joyous fellowship among Hindu brethren in their homes and communities. The archbishop emphasized that the light of Diwali symbolizes charity, harmony, and peace after conquering evil. He hoped that this festival would inspire future generations to spread the same light, allowing society to shine with love, truth, harmony, and freedom.

item.title: London police arrest dozens as pro-Palestinian rally draws counter-protests
item.description: More than 100,000 pro-Palestinian protesters marched through central London, resulting in over 80 arrests as police aimed to prevent clashes with opposing groups. The march, which took place on Armistice Day, drew counter-protesters from far-right groups and faced criticism from Prime Minister Rishi Sunak for being disrespectful. Skirmishes occurred between the counter-protesters and police near the Cenotaph war memorial. The pro-Palestinian rally had a large turnout, and police were determined to prevent the two groups from meeting. Some pro-Palestinian protesters used chants and banners that were viewed by many as antisemitic. Similar protests also took place in Paris, where several thousand demonstrators called for a ceasefire in Gaza. A protest against antisemitism has been scheduled for the following day in France.

item.title: Mansour bin Zayed participates in Joint Arab-Islamic Extraordinary Summit in Riyadh
item.description: The UAE delegation, led by Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan, attended the Joint Arab-Islamic Extraordinary Summit on the developments in Gaza. The summit aimed to discuss the situation in Gaza and the Palestinian territories. The participants emphasized the importance of an immediate ceasefire, protecting civilians, and providing humanitarian aid. Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed later left Saudi Arabia after the summit.The UAE delegation led by Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan, Vice President and Chairman of the Presidential Court, attended the joint Arab-Islamic extraordinary summit on the developments in Gaza. The summit, inaugurated by Prince Mohammed bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, discussed the situation in Gaza and the Palestinian territories. The participants emphasized the need for an immediate ceasefire, protection of civilians, and the opening of safe humanitarian corridors. Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed later left the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia after the summit.

item.title: Woman creates flutter in PM Modi’s rally in Hyderabad
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had to pause his speech during a rally in Hyderabad when he noticed a young woman climbing a structure with lights fixed on it. The incident occurred at the Parade Grounds where Modi was addressing a meeting organized by the Madiga Reservation Porata Samithi (MRPS), a community organization representing the Madigas, a significant group within the Scheduled Castes in Telugu states. Concerned about the condition of the electric wires, Modi urged the woman to come down and emphasized that he was there for the people. He was supported by Rajya Sabha member K Laxman, who translated the Prime Minister's request into Telugu. The police are currently verifying the incident. Prior to this interruption, Modi consoled Krishna Madiga, the founder of MRPS, who became emotional and hugged him at the beginning of the speech.

item.title: UAE dispatches 100 tonnes of food, medical supplies to support Palestinians in Gaza
item.description: The UAE has sent a plane carrying 100 tonnes of food, medical, and relief supplies to El Arish city in Egypt, as part of the "Tarahum for Gaza" campaign. The supplies will be used to support those affected in the Gaza Strip, particularly women, children, and the elderly. The campaign, launched last month, aims to provide relief for Palestinians and reflects the UAE's commitment to humanitarian efforts.The UAE has sent a plane carrying 100 tonnes of food, medical supplies, and relief items to Egypt's El Arish city as part of the "Tarahum for Gaza" campaign. The aid will be transported to the Gaza Strip through the Rafah Border Crossing in coordination with the UN World Food Programme. The UAE aims to alleviate the humanitarian conditions in Gaza by providing essential supplies, particularly for women, children, and the elderly. The campaign, launched last month, reflects the country's values of giving and human solidarity.

item.title: HP Governor inaugurates Lavi Mela in Shimla
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Lavi Mela in Himachal Pradesh has become a cultural festival in the region, according to Governor Shiv Pratap Shukla. The fair, which lasts for four days, not only preserves the area's rich traditions but also provides trade opportunities for locals. Former Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh was honored for his efforts in giving the fair international status in 1985. Shukla commended the organizers for showcasing unique textiles, crafts, and products, which gives traditional artisans and farmers a chance to sell their goods. The governor also inaugurated exhibitions and unveiled a video teaser for the international Lavi Fair to be held in 2023. Several folk dance groups performed at the event.

item.title: Tight security arrangements in Kolkata ahead of Diwali, Kali Puja
item.description: The Kolkata Police has implemented precautionary measures to maintain law and order and prevent the use of banned firecrackers during Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations in the city. Over 5,000 police personnel will be on duty, ensuring compliance with regulations and monitoring firecracker activity. Police officers will be stationed at various locations, including shopping malls, markets, religious places, railway stations, and jetties. The report is sourced from PTI news service and is not the responsibility of ThePrint.The Kolkata Police have implemented precautionary measures to maintain law and order and prevent the use of banned firecrackers during the Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations in Kolkata. Over 5,000 police personnel will be on duty, with officers monitoring the situation and ensuring compliance with the ban on firecrackers. Police presence will be increased at key locations such as shopping malls, markets, religious places, railway stations, and jetties. Approximately 21 deputy commissioners and 35 assistant commissioners will be deployed for this purpose.

item.title: Modi government made country secure by stopping infiltration: Amit Shah
item.description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah spoke at a public meeting in Madhya Pradesh, praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi for making the country secure by stopping infiltration. Shah criticized the opposition's India grouping and the Congress party for being incapable of stopping infiltration. He also highlighted the Modi government's actions such as banning the Popular Front of India (PFI), abrogating Article 370, carrying out surgical and air strikes on Pakistan, and making Kashmir an integral part of the country. Shah urged voters to elect a Modi government at the center and a BJP government in the state to secure the country. He claimed that the Congress party, which he accused of corruption and dynastic politics, will be wiped out from Madhya Pradesh. Shah also mentioned the transformative change brought by the BJP to the state in 18 years compared to the 53-year-long rule of the Congress. He announced the date of January 22, 2024, for the inauguration of the Ram temple in Ayodhya and accused Rahul Gandhi of mocking him in the past. Shah claimed that the Congress obstructed the construction of the temple for 70 years. He accused the Congress of insulting Indian culture while highlighting the initiatives taken by Modi, such as the construction of the Ram temple, Kashi Vishwanath corridor, and Kartarpur Sahib corridor. Shah also mentioned the Teerth Darshan Yojana pilgrimage scheme introduced by the BJP government and alleged that the Congress stalled it during its rule in Madhya Pradesh.

item.title: CPI(M) holds massive pro-Palestine rally at Kerala’s Kozhikode
item.description: The Communist Party of India (Marxist) held a rally in Kozhikode expressing solidarity with Palestine and criticizing the BJP-led Indian government for its alleged pro-Israel stance. Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan stated that the Left parties stand firmly with Palestine and accused the BJP of going against humanity. He claimed that while the people of India support Palestine, the government does not reflect their sentiments and instead cooperates with Israel. Vijayan also criticized the BJP government for diluting India's foreign policy to support Israel. The article mentions the controversy surrounding the CPI(M)'s invitation to the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML), causing tensions within the opposition United Democratic Front (UDF). The report also provides casualty figures from the conflict between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Pakistan play old school cricket to end World Cup with embarrassing defeat against England
item.description: England defeated Pakistan by 93 runs in their World Cup game, securing seventh place in the tournament. Pakistan's chances of qualifying for the semi-finals were shattered as England scored 337 runs in their innings, while Pakistan only managed 244 runs in response. Pakistan's batting performance was lackluster, with Babar Azam and Mohammed Rizwan struggling to make an impact. The pitch conditions at Eden Gardens made it difficult for Pakistan to chase a near 340-run target. England's star-studded batting lineup, including Ben Stokes, Joe Root, and Jonny Bairstow, contributed to their commendable total. Stokes, in particular, played a crucial role in their batting performance, scoring 84 runs. Pakistan's Haris Rauf and Shaheen Shah Afridi took wickets, but England lost momentum towards the end of their innings. Stokes, who returned from retirement, had a successful World Cup with three consecutive innings of 50-plus scores. Root also performed well, forming a 132-run partnership with Stokes. Bairstow provided a strong start for England with his quick 59 runs off 61 balls.

item.title: President Herzog speaks with German President on Kristallnacht anniversary
item.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog spoke with German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on the 85th anniversary of the Kristallnacht Pogrom. President Steinmeier expressed solidarity with Israel following a terrorist attack by Hamas. President Herzog thanked President Steinmeier for his support and friendship, and discussed Israel's ongoing battle against Hamas and efforts to secure the release of hostages. He emphasized the pain of the families affected and the symbolic significance of speaking on the anniversary of Kristallnacht. The article also provides background information on Kristallnacht, which marked the start of the Holocaust.

item.title: Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed attends Abu Dhabi International Boat Show
item.description: Sheikh Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, attended the Abu Dhabi international Boat Show (ADIBS) held at the Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre. He toured the pavilions showcasing the latest marine technology and praised the efforts of the organizers. The event aims to strengthen the presence of maritime companies in the region's markets and attract marine enthusiasts. This year's exhibition has seen significant local and international participation, with over 700 companies and brands from more than 15 countries. The event is expected to attract over 10,000 visitors. Sheikh Khaled was accompanied by other prominent figures from Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Ayodhya Deepotsav sets new Guinness world record by lighting over 22.23 lakh diyas
item.description: Ayodhya, a temple town in Uttar Pradesh, India, has set a new Guinness world record by lighting over 22.23 lakh earthen lamps during the 'Deepotsav 2023' festival. This broke the town's own record of 15.76 lakh lamps lit last year. The Uttar Pradesh Government's 'Grand Deepotsav' was recognized by the Guinness Book of World Records, and representatives from the organization witnessed and acknowledged the achievement. Teachers, students, and volunteer organizations all contributed to the creation of the record. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who initiated the Deepotsav festival in 2017, received warm greetings and congratulations for this accomplishment. The increasing number of lamps lit each year symbolizes the growing prosperity of the state and the country.

item.title: Our platform shall not be used for any election campaign: Samyukta Kisan Morcha
item.description: The Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM), the largest platform of farmers and farmworkers in India, has stated that it will not be involved in any election campaign. While individual members and constituent organizations are allowed to support and vote for their preferred candidates or political parties, the SKM as a whole will not endorse any particular candidate or party. This statement was made in response to three constituent organizations of the SKM in Rajasthan issuing a joint press note supporting a specific political party candidate. The SKM reiterates its position of not contesting elections or supporting any particular candidate or party.

item.title: Nath slams BJP for manifesto not mentioning Ladli Bahna Yojana dole hike, accuses Chouhan of lying
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) released its manifesto for the Madhya Pradesh assembly polls without mentioning an increase in the monthly financial aid under the Ladli Bahna Yojana to Rs 3,000, which was promised earlier by Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan. The manifesto includes promises such as reduced prices for cooking gas cylinders, free education for girls from poor families, higher minimum support price for wheat and paddy, houses for Ladli Bahna scheme beneficiaries, and free education up to class 12 for poor students. Kamal Nath, the state unit chief of the opposition Congress party, criticized the BJP for copying many promises from the Congress' announcements. Nath assured women that if the Congress comes to power, they will receive Rs 1,500 per month under the Nari Samman Yojana and gas cylinders at Rs 500 starting from January 1. The Congress has also promised to waive loans for farmers, fill vacant posts, provide free and subsidized power units, offer reservations for other backward classes, and reintroduce the old pension scheme. The state assembly polls are scheduled for November 17, with vote counting on December 3.

The IDF has accused Hamas of using Gaza hospitals and civilian infrastructure as cover for military operations. Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah has called for prolonging the war between Israel and Hamas, stating that pressure needs to be expanded. The IDF intercepted a Hezbollah anti-tank squad in southern Lebanon, and sirens sounded in an Israeli community. The IDF is responding to the attacks with artillery shelling.

item.title: 23-year-old man killed, two women injured as SUV hits two-wheelers
item.description: A 23-year-old man was killed and a woman and her daughter were seriously injured in Nagpur, India, after a rashly-driven SUV hit their scooters. The incident occurred on Friday night near a temple, and the SUV driver fled the scene after hitting an electric pole and overturning the vehicle. The police have registered a case under IPC section 304(a) and are conducting further investigations.A 23-year-old man was killed and a woman and her daughter were seriously injured after being hit by a rashly-driven SUV in Nagpur. The incident occurred near a temple on Friday night. The man was identified as Gaurav Raut, while the injured woman and her daughter were named Varsha Kharabe and Divyanshi. The SUV also collided with an electric pole and overturned before the driver fled the scene. The police have registered a case and further investigation is ongoing.

item.title: “Indian diaspora…worked hard for this initiative”: US official on Diwali holidays in New York
item.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has declared Diwali as a public school holiday for the first time in the city's history. Dilip Chauhan, Deputy Commissioner at the Mayor's office, praised the decision and credited the Indian diaspora and Indian-American community for their years of advocacy. Chauhan emphasized the significance of Diwali, which represents the festival of light over darkness. The announcement came after state lawmakers passed legislation designating Diwali as a holiday in the city's school system. Mayor Adams called it a significant win for local families.

item.title: Over 22 lakh ‘diyas’ light up Ayodhya as Deepotsav sets world record
item.description: The seventh edition of the Deepotsav in Ayodhya set a new world record by lighting over 22 lakh 'diyas' (earthen lanterns) along the banks of the Saryu river. The lamps were lit by 25,000 volunteers at the 51 ghats of Ram Ki Paidi. Representatives from the Guinness Book of World Records confirmed the record and awarded the city the status of a world record holder. The event was attended by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Governor Anandiben Patel, and diplomats from 54 countries. The Deepotsav, which has become a major event in the state since 2017, featured cultural presentations, Ramlila performances, and the participation of artists from India and abroad. The event coincided with Hanuman Jayanti and marked the countdown to the consecration ceremony of the idol of Lord Ram Lalla on January 22.

item.title: Congress govt implemented welfare schemes keeping in mind every section, says CM Gehlot
item.description: Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot of Rajasthan, India, stated that the Congress government implemented public welfare schemes for all sections of society during its five-year tenure. He expressed confidence that the public will return the party to power in the upcoming elections. Gehlot highlighted the achievements of the government, including the all-round development of the state and the benefits provided to households through schemes based on the opinions of the common people. He also announced seven guarantees, such as an annual honorarium for women heads of families and school education in English medium, if the Congress retains power. The voting for the Rajasthan Assembly will take place on November 25, with the results being counted on December 3.

item.title: Sisodia meets ailing wife after court’s permission
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Former Delhi deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia, who is currently in Tihar jail in connection with an alleged liquor scam case, was granted permission by a city court to meet his ailing wife for six hours. Sisodia spent the time with his wife at their home on Mathura Road, where he lit diyas for 'Choti Diwali'. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed his sympathy for Sisodia, questioning the injustice done to him. This is not the first time Sisodia has been allowed to meet his wife, as he was granted permission in June but could not do so due to her hospitalization. Sisodia's bail application in the case was recently rejected by the Supreme Court.

item.title: Eatery owner murdered in Nagpur by two staffers over financial dispute
item.description: An eatery owner in Nagpur, Maharashtra, was allegedly murdered by two of his employees following a financial dispute. The owner, Raju Bhaurao Dhengre, was attacked with a wooden log and strangled at around 3:30 am. The motive for the murder was an argument over salary and bonus, as the accused employees wanted to go on vacation for Diwali. After the incident, they fled in Dhengre's car, which they later abandoned after crashing near a bridge on Naag river in Vhirgaon. The local police are investigating the case, and political leader Chandrashekhar Bawankule has sought the immediate arrest of the culprits.

item.title: “Biggest blessing”: Parineeti Chopra’s mother Reena pens sweet birthday wish for son-in-law Raghav Chadha
item.description: Parineeti Chopra's mother, Reena Chopra, has written a heartwarming birthday message for her son-in-law and Aam Aadmi Party MP, Raghav Chadha. Reena shared pictures on Instagram with a caption expressing gratitude for his presence in their lives and the family they have formed. Parineeti also posted sweet pictures with her husband, praising his intelligence, values, and commitment to family. The couple got married in September, with the ceremony attended by well-known figures from the entertainment industry and politics. Their love story is said to have started in London while they were studying together. On the work front, Parineeti will be starring alongside Diljit Dosanjh in the film 'Chamkila', directed by Imtiaz Ali.

item.title: Pradhan urges Gadkari to expand NHs from Raigarh to Talcher to 8 lanes
item.description: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan has requested his cabinet colleague Nitin Gadkari to expand an economic corridor connecting two national highways between Raigarh in Chhattisgarh and Talcher in Odisha. The minister highlighted the presence of major industrial areas along this corridor and emphasized the need for expanding the roads to accommodate the growing economic activities in the region. The industrial zones in the area include Ib Valley for thermal power, sponge iron, refractories, and coal mines, Hirakud for aluminium and rolling mills, and Talcher-Angul for power plants, coal washeries, and ferroalloys. Pradhan pointed out that this region has become not only the industrial backbone of Odisha but also of the nation. Currently, there are ongoing developmental works to upgrade NH-49 and NH-53 into four-lane highways. Pradhan requested the upgrading of this stretch to an eight-lane economic corridor to improve infrastructure and boost the economy of both the state and the nation.

item.title: “Israel occupation responsible for crimes against Palestinians”; says Saudi Prince at summit on Gaza
item.description: Saudi Arabian Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has blamed the "Israeli occupation" for the crimes committed against Palestinians. Speaking at the Arab Islamic Summit, he called for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza and criticized the international community's silence on the violations against Palestinian civilians. The crown prince also emphasized the need for a coordinated effort among Arab and Islamic states to lift the siege in Gaza and deliver humanitarian aid. He reiterated the importance of ending the occupation and establishing a Palestinian state on the 1967 borders with East Jerusalem as its capital. The emergency summit was held in response to the ongoing situation in Gaza, with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan also expressing concern and calling for a ceasefire. Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi arrived in Saudi Arabia to participate in the summit, wearing a traditional Palestinian keffiyeh scarf.

item.title: AIIMS Delhi takes measures on taxis overcharging patients for short trips
item.description: AIIMS Delhi has announced a plan to regulate the entry of commercial passenger vehicles into the hospital campus following reports of drivers overcharging patients. The initiative will install bilingual signages providing information about transportation options and introduce a number plate reader camera-based ticketing system. Vehicles exiting within 15 minutes will not be charged, while those exiting after 15 minutes will incur a fee of Rs 50 per half hour. The ticketing system will rely on automated technology and is scheduled to be implemented by December 31. The aim of these measures is to enhance the overall experience for patients seeking medical care at AIIMS.

item.title: Delhi Police takes out flag march in overcrowded markets
item.description: The Delhi Police conducted a flag march in overcrowded markets to ensure security during the ongoing festive season. The march started from Virat Chowk, Ambedkar Nagar in South Delhi. The police have also tightened security in other markets such as Janpath Market, Connaught Place, Sarojini Market, Khan Market, Chandni Chowk, and Sadar Bazar. Local police officers have been instructed to maintain a strict vigil in their respective areas. Traffic police have been directed to provide parking facilities and issue alerts about potential traffic jams. The report is auto-generated from PTI News Service, and ThePrint is not responsible for its content.
