item.title: Tennis-Italy overcome spirited Slovenia to reach BJK Cup final
item.description: Italy secured a 2-0 victory over Slovenia in Sevilla, Spain, in the Billie Jean King Cup, advancing to the final and keeping their bid for a fifth crown alive. Jasmine Paolini defeated Tamara Zidansek in a grueling match, while Martina Trevisan beat Kaja Juvan to give Italy the win. Italy's last victory in the competition was ten years ago. They will face tough competition from the Czech Republic or Canada in the final.Italy secured a 2-0 victory over Slovenia in Seville on Saturday, advancing to the Billie Jean King Cup final. Jasmine Paolini defeated Tamara Zidansek in a tight match, while Martina Trevisan beat Kaja Juvan to give Italy the win. This victory puts Italy on track for their fifth crown in the team competition. Italy's last triumph in the competition was 10 years ago. They will face either the Czech Republic or Canada in the final.

item.title: Soccer-Wolves stun Spurs 2-1 with two stoppage-time goals
item.description: In a surprising turn of events, Wolverhampton Wanderers defeated Tottenham Hotspur 2-1 with last-minute goals from Pablo Sarabia and Mario Lemina. Sarabia, who was brought on as a substitute, scored the equalizer in the 91st minute and provided the assist for Lemina's winning goal in the 97th minute. This victory prevented Tottenham from regaining the top spot in the Premier League table, leaving them in second place behind Manchester City. Wolves climbed to 12th place in the standings with this win. Despite injuries and suspensions forcing Tottenham to field a makeshift defense, they took an early lead through Brennan Johnson's goal. The first half saw back-and-forth action, but Wolves lacked the finishing touch. Sarabia finally equalized in the 91st minute, and Lemina secured the win in stoppage time. Both teams acknowledged the tough nature of the game, with Spurs manager Ange Postecoglou admitting his side ran out of energy towards the end.

item.title: Iceland evacuates town over concerns of volcanic eruption
item.description: Icelandic authorities have evacuated 3,000 residents from a town in the southwest of the island due to concerns of a volcanic eruption. The Icelandic Meteorological Office has warned of a "considerable" risk of an eruption on the Reykjanes Peninsula, citing the size and movement of the underground magma intrusion. Professor Thorvaldur Thordarson, a volcanology expert, believes an eruption could occur within hours or days. The evacuation order is not described as an emergency, but authorities believe there is an immediate risk to the town. The area has experienced previous volcanic activity, including eruptions in 2021 and 2022. The current eruption threat is in the Fagradalsfjall volcanic system, which had been inactive for over 6,000 years prior to recent eruptions.

item.title: LinkedIn says spy firm targeted Hungarian activists, journalists before 2022 election
item.description: Private spy firm Black Cube used LinkedIn to target Hungarian activists and journalists in a hidden video campaign leading up to Hungary's 2022 election, according to the professional networking site. Black Cube, based in Israel, created a network of fake personas on LinkedIn that used bogus job postings to connect with their targets. Video conversations occurred off-platform, and clips from those conversations were used to discredit NGOs in Hungary. LinkedIn has taken down the fake accounts and removed Black Cube's company page due to violations of its terms of service. Black Cube has previously been accused of interfering in Hungary's 2018 elections by secretly recording NGO leaders and publishing the footage on right-wing news outlets. The operation attributed to Black Cube by LinkedIn began in 2020 and targeted at least 12 activists and journalists critical of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban. The footage was widely covered in Hungarian media ahead of the election, which resulted in a victory for Orban's party.

item.title: Israel’s war on Hamas homes in on Gaza hospitals
item.description: The article reports on the dire situation in Gaza, where a baby has died and many patients are at risk due to an Israeli siege around Al Shifa hospital. Israel claims that Hamas militants have used hospitals as command centers, leading to their demand for evacuation. However, Hamas denies these allegations and argues that moving patients could result in their deaths. The hospital has suspended operations due to fuel shortages caused by Israeli shelling. Palestinian officials claim that Israeli snipers on nearby rooftops and ongoing bombardment make it dangerous for medics and people to move. Furthermore, clashes between Israeli troops and Hamas gunmen have been reported throughout Gaza City. The article also mentions that Hamas has requested international investigations into Israeli allegations of military use of hospitals. As the crisis continues, the health ministry warns that failure to bring in fuel will be a death sentence for patients, including 39 babies at risk. The World Health Organization expresses concerns about the safety of healthcare workers. Israel states that rockets are still being fired from Gaza into southern Israel, and it has implemented temporary pauses in firing to allow Gazans to evacuate. The article concludes by mentioning that Muslim and Arab countries meeting in Saudi Arabia called for an immediate end to military operations in Gaza and held Israel responsible for "crimes" against Palestinians.

item.title: J-K DGP to meet people twice every month to address grievances
item.description: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police (DGP) R R Swain has announced that he will hold two-hour public grievance meetings twice a month. The DGP urges individuals with complaints to submit written statements or applications. This decision was made after people began approaching the police headquarters in Jammu without prior appointments as grievance redressal seekers. The DGP emphasizes that grievances should be addressed by junior officers in the field, and priority will be given to those whose issues remain unresolved despite approaching local police units.

item.title: Three Bangladeshi tourists die in houseboat fire in India’s Kashmir
item.description: Three Bangladeshi tourists died in a fire that broke out in houseboats stationed in India's Kashmir region. The fire quickly spread to other nearby boats, resulting in the destruction of five houseboats and the injury of seven others. The preliminary investigation revealed that faulty electric wiring caused the fire. The Jammu and Kashmir region, known for its natural beauty, received a record high of 16.2 million tourists in 2022. The increase in tourist arrivals is beneficial for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government, which integrated the Muslim-majority region with the rest of India in 2019. However, Kashmir has been experiencing an ongoing separatist Islamist insurgency and is also claimed by neighboring Pakistan.

item.title: Three Bangladeshi tourists killed in Dal Lake blaze in Kashmir
item.description: Three tourists from Bangladesh were killed in a fire that engulfed a houseboat on Dal Lake in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. The victims were identified as Anindaya Kowshal, Mohammad Moinud, and Das Gupta. The cause of the fire is still unknown, but preliminary investigations suggest it may have started due to a malfunctioning heating appliance. Eight people were rescued, and DNA samples were taken from the victims for identification purposes. The fire destroyed five houseboats, seven residential huts, and neighboring houses, resulting in extensive property damage. This incident follows a similar fire in April 2022 that gutted seven houseboats on Nigeen Lake. Lt Governor Manoj Sinha expressed his condolences and directed the District Administration to provide necessary assistance to the affected individuals. The Kashmir Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KCCI) called for compensation and swift permission for the reconstruction of the damaged houseboats.

item.title: French envoy Thierry Mathou “excited to celebrate first Diwali” in India
item.description: The French Ambassador to India, Thierry Mathou, extended his Diwali wishes and expressed his enjoyment of the festive atmosphere in India. He shared a video of his wife exploring Indian markets and purchasing handicrafts and diyas. Rishi Sunak, the first British Asian Prime Minister, also extended Diwali wishes and emphasized looking towards the future with hope. He also wished Bandi Chhor Divas to the Sikh community. Dilip Chauhan, Deputy Commissioner at the New York City Mayor's Office, highlighted the significance of Diwali this year, as it has been declared a public holiday in the city's schools.

item.title: ‘ATCM Adityanath pulls chariot to mark symbolic return of Lord Ram to Ayodhya
item.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Governor Anandiben Patel participated in a ceremony in Ayodhya, where a chariot carrying artistes depicting the return of Lord Ram, Sita, and Lakshman after 14 years of exile was pulled. Flowers were showered on them from a helicopter. The Chief Minister extended his Diwali greetings and emphasized the significance of the event, stating that Lord Ram would soon be enshrined in his grand temple. He also highlighted the development projects in Ayodhya and the expected increase in tourism after the inauguration of the Ram temple. The Governor and Chief Minister released a coffee table book based on the Deepotsav festival, which is being organized for the seventh time. Last year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi also participated in the event.

item.title: Pro-Palestinian rally kicks off in London amid Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Thousands of people gathered in central London for a pro-Palestinian rally to protest against Israeli aggression in Gaza. The protesters held signs that read "Free Palestine." The Metropolitan Police mobilized 1,850 officers to anticipate potential conflicts and disruption from splinter groups and far-right activists. The demonstrators planned to march to the US embassy to protest against the US's support for Israel. This protest was expected to draw even larger numbers than previous ones due to the political debate surrounding its occurrence. Counterprotesters faced off with the police, and a large group of counterprotesters was detained. In the US, anti-Israel demonstrators stormed Grand Central Terminal, closed the station, burned an Israeli flag, and chanted slogans against Israel.

item.title: Teammates have advised Babar not to step down: PCB sources
item.description: Pakistan cricket captain Babar Azam has been advised by his teammates not to step down from his position, despite criticism following the team's failure to qualify for the World Cup semi-finals. Babar has a strong following within the team, and players such as Imam ul Haq, Shadab Khan, Shaheen Shah Afridi, and Haris Rauf are considered to be close to him. Babar is expected to leave the decision of his captaincy up to the Pakistan Cricket Board, headed by Zaka Ashraf. While Babar has had success in T20 Internationals, his record in Tests and ODIs has been less impressive. The PCB head has stated that he will consult with former players, including Misbah ul Haq and Muhammad Hafeez, before making any decisions regarding the captaincy and team management.

item.title: Vijayendra’s appointment: Senior BJP leader Ravi says he too is haunted by questions
item.description: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Karnataka is facing criticism for practicing "dynasty politics" after appointing B Y Vijayendra, the son of veteran leader B S Yediyurappa, as its state unit president. In response to questions about this appointment, senior BJP leader C T Ravi cryptically stated that he too is being haunted by certain "questions." Ravi congratulated Vijayendra and emphasized that he is not an aspirant for any post. He also mentioned that the responsibility has been given to Vijayendra to strengthen the party and achieve good results in future elections. Ravi avoided commenting on the issue of dynasty politics and stated that discussing such questions in public is not appropriate. He affirmed his commitment to working as a party member to bring back the Modi government in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. The article also mentions that some senior BJP leaders may be upset about Vijayendra's appointment, but no public statements have been made.

item.title: Pak stays till Dec 31st its decision to deport legal Afghan residents: Official
item.description: The Pakistan government has suspended its decision to repatriate legal Afghan refugee residents whose residency documents expired this year. The pause will be in effect until December 31. Previously, the government had planned to send back Afghans living with legal documents after their expiration. The deportation of illegal Afghan refugees has been ongoing, with as many as 250,000 voluntarily returning home and 80,000 being deported. The decision was made due to concerns that Afghan soil is being used by terrorists to target Pakistan. Pressure from international organizations and countries has urged Pakistan not to deport Afghans who fled the Taliban rule or conflict in their home country. Pakistan claims there are approximately 1.7 million illegal Afghan residents. Human rights groups have criticized Pakistan's move, warning of a potential humanitarian crisis and increased child labor in Afghanistan.

item.title: Committee to be set up soon to empower Madigas, says PM Modi in rally in Hyderabad
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced that a committee will be formed to empower the Madigas, a Scheduled Caste community, in response to their demand for categorization. Speaking at a rally organized by the Madiga Reservation Porata Samithi (MRPS), Modi pledged to end the injustice faced by the Madigas and ensure their access to justice through legal processes. He also criticized the Congress party for its treatment of B.R. Ambedkar, the architect of the Indian constitution. Modi accused the Congress of preventing Ambedkar from winning elections and not displaying his portrait in parliament. He also took a swipe at the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) government, stating that it had failed to appoint a Dalit chief minister as promised during the statehood agitation. Modi apologized on behalf of political parties and leaders who had made promises to the Madigas in the past and betrayed them. During the rally, Modi interacted with a young woman who had climbed a structure and thanked her for expressing her concerns.

item.title: ‘Act of sacrilege’: Outrage over AR Rahman’s rendition of Bengali poet Nazrul Islam’s patriotic song
item.description: Controversy has erupted over AR Rahman's rendition of a popular patriotic song by Bengali poet Kazi Nazrul Islam in the Bollywood film "Pippa." The family of Nazrul Islam and several singers have expressed outrage at the "distortion" of the song's rhythm and tunes. The song, titled "Karar Oi Louho Kopat" (Iron Bars of a Jail), was released as part of the war movie based on real-life events during the 1971 India-Pakistan war. Nazrul's family has called for the song to be removed from the film and public domain. Bengali singer Haimanti Shukla and Nazrul's granddaughter Anindita Kazi have also voiced their protest against the change in the song's tune. The controversy has caused social media outrage, with many questioning whether AR Rahman did sufficient research before altering the song.

item.title: Punjab govt to recruit over 1,400 police personnel
item.description: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has approved the recruitment of 1,450 additional police personnel in the state. The positions include 50 inspectors, 150 sub-inspectors, 500 assistant sub-inspectors, and 750 head constables. The aim is to involve youth in the socio-economic growth of the state and provide them with government job opportunities. The state government has already provided jobs to 37,683 youth in Punjab, completing the recruitment drive in just 18 months. This recruitment will help streamline the functioning of the police force at the district level.

item.title: J-K’s Kishtwar to soon emerge as north India’s power hub: Union minister Jitendra Singh
item.description: Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar region is set to become a major power hub in North India, generating around 6,000 MW of electricity after the completion of ongoing power projects, according to Union Minister Jitendra Singh. He visited remote areas of Kishtwar and inaugurated a new school in the village of Massu. Singh highlighted the significant hydropower projects in the region and emphasized that they would not only improve power supply but also provide opportunities for locals. He credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi for prioritizing neglected regions like Kishtwar. Singh also mentioned the improvement in road travel to Kishtwar and the development of infrastructure in the region.

item.title: Shiv Sena (UBT) ‘shakha’ razed: Those high on power will be taught a lesson, warns Uddhav
item.description: Uddhav Thackeray, the chief of the Shiv Sena, criticized the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena for destroying a local office controlled by the Shiv Sena. Thackeray, along with other Sena leaders, visited the site but faced resistance from workers of the CM's Shiv Sena. Thackeray condemned the destruction of the office and promised to retaliate in the elections. He also accused the administration of being helpless and stated that the Shiv Sena would continue to assemble at the site daily. Thackeray warned the administration and police that they would face consequences for protecting the "thieves" who destroyed the office. The report is auto-generated by the PTI news service.

He visited Gulabgarh and inaugurated a new school for village children. Singh highlighted that several major hydropower projects have been developed in the region in recent years, including the Pakal Dul project with a capacity of 1,000 MW and the Kiru hydroelectric project with a capacity of 624 MW. These projects aim to improve the power supply in Jammu and Kashmir and provide economic opportunities for the local population. Singh also mentioned the development of infrastructure, such as roads, mobile towers, and a new airport in Kishtwar during the tenure of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

item.title: People of Rajasthan will vote for Bharat Jodo Yatra’s message: Congress
item.description: The Congress party is confident of winning the upcoming Rajasthan assembly polls. They believe that the people of the state will support their message of fighting inequality, unemployment, and political dictatorship by the Narendra Modi government. Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh expressed his confidence while reminiscing about the Bharat Jodo Yatra, a 485-km-long journey through Rajasthan in December last year. Ramesh stated that the yatra had a profound impact on the political fortunes of the Indian National Congress in Rajasthan and other parts of India. He further added that when the people of Rajasthan vote on November 25, the Congress will get the mandate again. They will vote for the message of the yatra and for the achievements of the Congress government led by Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot. The article also mentions that the 200-member Rajasthan assembly will go to polls on November 25, and the counting of votes will be on December 3.

item.title: Raja Kumari releases music video for her song ‘No Nazar’
item.description: Rapper Raja Kumari has released the music video for her song "No Nazar" from her own label Godmother Records. The song was written during a dark time in Kumari's life and is meant to protect listeners from the evil eye and negative energy. Kumari also recently collaborated with Sushmita Sen on the music video for "Sherni Aayi" from the show "Aarya 3." She expressed admiration for Sen's positivity and strength, and the song is a tribute to strong women facing challenges. Kumari previously gained recognition for her rap in Shah Rukh Khan's film "Jawan."

item.title: JP Nadda mourns demise of Telugu actor Chandra Mohan
item.description: Telugu actor Chandra Mohan has passed away at the age of 82 after suffering a cardiac arrest. Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) National President JP Nadda expressed his condolences on social media, praising the actor's versatile and charismatic performances throughout his career. Chandra Mohan, also known as Mallampalli Chandrasekhar Rao, entered the Telugu film industry in 1966 and went on to act in several notable films. item.title: Punjab records over 100 farm fires; Haryana’s air quality at many places in ‘moderate’ category
item.description: Punjab reported 104 farm fires, bringing the total number of stubble-burning incidents to 23,730. This is a decrease from previous days. Stubble burning in Punjab and Haryana is a major cause of air pollution in Delhi. Only six cases of stubble burning were reported in Punjab on Friday due to rain. Sangrur district had the highest number of cases with 43, followed by Mansa with 22. The total number of farm fires this season is 42% less than last year. Air quality in Haryana and Punjab has improved and is now in the 'satisfactory' and 'moderate' categories.

item.title: Morning walker attacked with cricket bat in Latur; two booked
item.description: A 53-year-old woman and her son were violently attacked with a cricket bat by a couple in Latur city, Maharashtra. The incident occurred in the Shrinivas Nagar area, and the police have registered a case against the couple named Gopal and Sapna Darak based on a complaint. The woman, Sangeeta Rajkumar Bhosle, was out on a morning walk when the couple intercepted her and assaulted her. Her son, who was nearby, also tried to intervene and was also beaten up. The attack lasted for about 30 minutes, resulting in serious injuries for the woman. No arrests have been made so far.

item.title: Turbulent winters are coming. Blame El Niño and global warming combo
item.description: According to a new forecast from the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), the climate pattern known as "El Niño" is predicted to intensify over the winter, potentially leading to a winter of extreme weather, particularly in the US. El Niño refers to a rise in sea surface temperatures in the tropical eastern Pacific, which results in warmer-than-average weather globally. After three years of a cooling phase called La Niña, El Niño is returning at a time when the world is already experiencing high temperatures due to climate change. As a result, NOAA predicts warmer-than-average temperatures in wide areas of the US, along with above-average rainfall in some southern states. El Niño's impact extends beyond the Americas, with potential hotter and drier weather in areas like Australia and Indonesia, and increased hurricane activity in the Pacific Ocean. Studies suggest that global warming may lead to stronger El Niño phases, and climate-related risks are a top concern for risk experts. Mitigating and adapting to climate change is seen as the most pressing issue of the next decade.

item.title: IPL contract will be next level for Netherlands players after WC show: Coach Ryan Cook
item.description: The coach of the Netherlands cricket team, Ryan Cook, is hopeful that some of his players have caught the attention of IPL franchises ahead of this year's auction. The Netherlands has performed well in the World Cup, securing memorable wins against South Africa and Bangladesh. Cook believes that participation in the IPL would be a significant step up for his players and that the experience gained would be valuable. He pointed out the quality and availability of Dutch players as reasons for IPL teams to consider them. Cook acknowledged that the lack of cricket to play after their World Cup qualification has affected their preparation for the tournament. Despite this, he expressed excitement about facing India, stating that they are a strong team. Cook also spoke positively about the time his team spent in Bengaluru for warm-up matches.

item.title: Death toll in Haryana’s spurious liquor case climbs to 18
item.description: A suspected case of poisoning due to the consumption of spurious liquor has claimed the lives of 18 people in Haryana, with six more deaths reported recently. Previous reports indicated that 10 people had already died in Yamunanagar, and two in Ambala. In response to the incident, Yamunanagar police have arrested seven individuals and plan to arrest more based on the information they have gathered. The police have also been informing villagers about the incident and warning against consuming liquor of unknown origin. Opposition parties have criticized the government for its failure to address problems related to spurious liquor. The deaths have occurred in various villages in Yamunanagar, prompting the police to establish a special investigation team. The cabinet minister has assured strict action against those responsible, and the police investigation is ongoing.

item.title: Haze over Kolkata as pollution levels rise ahead of Kali Puja
item.description: The air quality in Kolkata has deteriorated, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) ranging from poor to very poor. The burning of crop residues in neighboring districts and the use of firecrackers during Kali Puja celebrations have worsened the situation. The AQI at various locations in the city was recorded as very poor or poor. Environmentalists warn that the pollution could cause respiratory problems and recommend sprinkling water on plants in the evening to reduce the pollution's effects. Illegal fireworks are expected to further worsen air pollution in the coming days.

They will also observe a fast in support of their demand. The activists are part of the Adivasi Sengel Abhiyan (ASA) group, and its president, Salkhan Murmu, stated that the decision to immolate was made independently by two ASA members. The activists are expecting the Prime Minister to address their demand for the recognition of a separate 'Sarna' religion and will carry out immolations at 4 pm at Ulihatu and Bokaro if their demand is not met. ASA leaders from Assam, Bengal, and Jharkhand have decided to hold a rail and road blockade on December 30 to support their cause. Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren has stated that the decision to recognize the 'Sarna' religion is pending with the center. Soren has previously requested the recognition of the 'Sarna' code for tribals, asserting that their population in the region has decreased over the years.

item.title: Can taking salt off the table help prevent diabetes? It’s not that simple
item.description: A new study from Tulane University in New Orleans suggests that salt consumption may be linked to an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes. However, the study is an observational study and cannot prove causation, only association. The data used to assess salt intake was based on a simple question, making it difficult to accurately estimate the amount of salt associated with an increased risk. Most salt intake comes from processed foods rather than added at the table. The study also found a weak association between salt consumption and the risk of developing type 2 diabetes, but did not provide specific recommendations for reducing salt intake. The key takeaway is that maintaining a healthy weight, being physically active, and eating a healthy diet are known to reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes.

item.title: Diwali eve rush slows down traffic on Delhi roads
item.description: Massive traffic jams were reported in several parts of New Delhi, including Ghazipur and Nangloi, on the eve of Diwali as people crowded the markets. There were long delays on the Ghazipur border towards Ghaziabad, with commuters stuck for hours. Some users on social media claimed that sellers illegally encroached on the road, causing a traffic jam. People also complained of congestion in other areas such as Nangloi and the GT Road. The heavy traffic was exacerbated by intermittent rain showers. The Delhi police had issued an advisory asking commuters to use public transport to avoid inconvenience and reduce pollution.

item.title: UAE Embassy, Cyprus National Library organise cultural initiative
item.description: The UAE Embassy in Nicosia, in collaboration with the Cyprus National Library, has initiated a program to promote cultural cooperation between the national libraries of the UAE and Cyprus. The UAE Ambassador to Cyprus, Mohammed Saif Al Shehhi, praised the strong bilateral ties between the two countries, particularly in the cultural realm, and expressed a desire for increased cooperation and coordination. The "Exchange of Books" initiative aims to strengthen cultural ties between the UAE and Cyprus and encourage collaboration in various sectors. Both sides emphasized the importance of culture in bringing people and nations closer together, as well as the significance of mutual historical and cultural understanding. The initiative includes discussions on methods to enhance cultural cooperation and establish joint coordination between national libraries.

The trip holds a special place in Arjun's heart as it was his first trip with just his dad. Boney Kapoor was previously married to Mona Kapoor, with whom he has two children. Boney Kapoor also has daughters with the late actress Sridevi.

item.title: CM Adityanath pulls chariot to mark symbolic return of Lord Ram to Ayodhya
item.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Governor Anandiben Patel participated in a procession that depicted the return of Lord Ram, Sita, and Lakshman to Ayodhya after 14 years of exile. Flowers were showered on them from a helicopter. Lord Ram's brothers Bharat and Shatrughan welcomed them, and they proceeded towards the venue of Ramkatha Park. The governor and chief minister performed the aarti and the symbolic coronation of Lord Ram. They also released a coffee table book on the Deepotsav festival of Ayodhya. This festival has been organized for the seventh time, with last year's event being attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. In 2022, a Guinness World Record was set with 15.76 lakh lamps being lit at Ram ki Pauri in Ayodhya.

item.title: Mubadala Health kicks off two-day Diabetes Conference in Abu Dhabi
item.description: The Mubadala Health Diabetes Conference was successfully launched by Imperial College London Diabetes Centre and HealthPlus Diabetes and Endocrinology Center. The conference brought together global experts to address critical issues in diabetes management. On the first day, renowned medical experts shared the latest advancements in diabetes care through talks and panel discussions. The conference emphasized collaboration and innovation in driving progress. Topics covered included diabetes guidelines, blood sugar management, complications, prevention and treatment, gestational diabetes, and care for patients of all ages. Workshops focused on cases from the diabetes type 1 clinic, diabetes type 2 clinic, and obesity and lipid clinic. The conference aims to unite healthcare practitioners in the fight against diabetes and promote knowledge sharing and research. (Please stay in character!)

item.title: HC stays termination of seven teachers by Jalna school
item.description: The Aurangabad bench of the Bombay High Court has granted relief to seven teachers who were terminated by the management of an English medium school in Jalna. The teachers, with service periods ranging from six to 26 years, had filed a writ petition over their low and irregular salaries and termination. They claimed to have received temporary appointment orders annually, but were terminated without notice or cause. The court stayed the termination order, directed the school to deposit outstanding salaries, and instructed the education department to collect information about the school's functioning. The school management was asked to submit a reply by December 6.

item.title: Taliban embassy in Qatar raises concerns over Afghan refugees’ forced deportation by Pakistan
item.description: The Taliban's Embassy in Qatar has expressed concerns about the forced deportation of Afghan refugees from Pakistan in a memorandum addressed to diplomatic and international organizations. The memo, obtained by Khaama Press, criticizes Pakistan for its mistreatment and inadequate handling of Afghan refugees during the deportation process. It highlights that Pakistan made the decision to deport Afghan refugees without consulting the Afghan government, leading to a humanitarian crisis. The Afghan Embassy in Qatar calls for Pakistan to be held accountable for the consequences of its actions and to collaborate with Afghanistan in finding solutions to the crisis. The statement also raises concerns about the well-being and rights of Afghan nationals facing harsh conditions and mistreatment during repatriation. The mass deportation of Afghan nationals poses significant challenges for Afghanistan, which must reintegrate these individuals into society and provide essential services. The Afghan government seeks international support and attention for the issue, aiming to uphold the rights and dignity of its citizens. The report emphasizes the need for cooperation, diplomacy, and international engagement to address the deportation crisis and ensure the well-being of Afghan refugees.

item.title: Pakistan seeks USD600 million from Chinese banks amid IMF bailout negotiations
item.description: Pakistan has formally requested fresh loans amounting to USD 600 million from two Chinese banks, as part of its ongoing negotiations with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for a USD 3 billion bailout package. The Pakistani government is in discussions with the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and the Bank of China, seeking a combined loan of USD 600 million. China has been a crucial source of financial support for Pakistan, providing various forms of assistance. These loans are important for Pakistan's low credit ratings and fragile macroeconomic situation, which have made it challenging to secure financing. Successful completion of the negotiations is expected to have a positive impact on Pakistan's credit ratings and access to capital markets. Under the terms of the IMF bailout deal, Pakistan has committed to adopting a market-based exchange rate regime.

item.title: Delhi HC asks city government to respond to widow’s plea for ex-gratia after husband’s death due to COVID-19
item.description: The Delhi High Court has asked the city government and Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) to respond to a plea by the wife of a COVID-19 warrior seeking the release of an ex-gratia of Rs 1 crore. The petitioner's husband, who was employed with the civic body, died after contracting the disease while performing duties during the pandemic. The court has listed the matter for further hearing in January 2024. The Delhi government had previously announced an ex-gratia of Rs 1 crore for the families of frontline COVID-19 warriors who died in the line of duty. The petitioner claims that her husband, who was a permanent employee of the East Delhi Municipal Corporation, is eligible for the compensation. She has received a compensation of Rs 10 lakh from the EDMC but is yet to receive the promised ex-gratia amount from the Delhi government. The plea seeks a direction to the Delhi government to release the money.

item.title: Deepfake video: Delhi Police writes to Meta for URL
item.description: The Delhi Police has contacted Meta, the parent company of Facebook, requesting the URL of the account responsible for sharing a 'deepfake' video of actress Rashmika Mandanna on social media. The police have also sought information about the individuals who shared the fake video. An FIR has been registered under forgery and IT Act sections after a complaint from the Delhi Commission for Women. A dedicated team is working on the case, with hopes of solving it soon. The deepfake video, suspected to be made with artificial intelligence, went viral last week, featuring Mandanna's face edited onto that of a British-Indian influencer.

item.title: 45-year-old woman trampled to death by wild elephant in Odisha’s Kalahandi
item.description: A 45-year-old woman in Odisha's Kalahandi district was killed by an elephant while she was going to a nearby stream to wash clothes. The elephant chased her and trampled her to death. The woman's body was sent for post-mortem examination and her family will receive financial assistance.A 45-year-old woman was killed by an elephant in Odisha's Kalahandi district. Sunak, as the first British Asian Prime Minister and a devout Hindu himself, also emphasized the celebration of the UK's ethnic and cultural diversity. He recently hosted a Diwali reception at 10 Downing Street, attended by members of the Indian diaspora and Bollywood stars. The article also mentions entrepreneur Roop Partap Choudhary, who was among the guests at a special "Diwali Milan" hosted by the Prime Minister and his wife.

item.title: BJP promises LPG cylinder at Rs 450, free education, higher MSP in its manifesto for Madhya Pradesh polls
item.description: The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Madhya Pradesh has released its manifesto for the upcoming assembly elections. The manifesto includes promises such as providing cooking gas cylinders at a reduced price for beneficiaries of certain schemes, free education up to post-graduation level for girls from poor families, higher minimum support prices for wheat and paddy, houses for beneficiaries of the Ladli Behna scheme, and free education up to Class 12 for poor students. Other promises include the continuation of farmer welfare schemes, the establishment of technological and medical institutes, the construction of expressways, empowerment of tribal communities, and various other development initiatives. The BJP claims that its manifesto reflects the aspirations of the people and that it has a track record of implementing its promises.

item.title: PM Modi condoles death of noted Telugu actor Chandra Mohan
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his sorrow over the passing of renowned Telugu actor Chandra Mohan. He praised Mohan for his powerful performances and unique charisma that captivated audiences for generations. Modi acknowledged the void left by Mohan's departure in the creative world and extended his condolences to his family and numerous admirers. Chandra Mohan, aged 82, had a successful career spanning over five decades and was admitted to a private hospital after being unresponsive for about 20 minutes.Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed sorrow over the death of renowned Telugu actor Chandra Mohan. Modi praised Mohan for his powerful performances and unique charisma that captivated audiences for generations. The prime minister acknowledged that Mohan's departure leaves a void in the creative world that will be difficult to fill. He extended his condolences to Mohan's family and countless admirers. Mohan, known for his versatile roles in a career spanning over five decades, was admitted to a hospital after being unresponsive for 20 minutes.

item.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan’s wife may be arrested in a corruption case: Report
item.description: Bushra Bibi, the wife of former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan, may face serious trouble, including potential imprisonment, in an alleged corruption case, according to a media report. The National Accountability Bureau (NAB) is examining evidence related to financial transactions that Bibi allegedly received. If confirmed, this evidence could change her status from a witness to an accused individual, and she may also be arrested. The NAB is also accelerating its investigation into Khan's alleged corruption cases. Bibi and her close aide, Farah Shahzadi, have been summoned by the NAB in connection with the Al-Qadir Trust corruption case. Recent reports have alleged corruption by Shahzadi, linking her to Khan and Bibi. These developments could pose additional problems for Khan, who served as prime minister from August 2018 to April 2022.

item.description: Preparations are underway at Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan's house for Choti Diwali. Kareena shared pictures on Instagram of herself, her two sons Taimur and Jeh, and her husband Saif decorating their home. In one of the images, Jeh can be seen spreading colors all over the floors while making a rangoli. Kareena humorously summed up the moment, saying they had fun despite the mess. Kareena and Saif got married in 2012 and have two children together. They have also worked together in several films. Currently, Kareena's film "The Buckingham Murders" and Saif's film "Devara" are in the works.

item.title: Ananya Panday, Aditya Roy Kapur pose with Katrina-Vicky at Diwali party, see pic
item.description: Rumored Bollywood couple Aditya Roy Kapur and Ananya Panday attended producer Amritpal Singh's Diwali bash in Mumbai, along with other celebrities like Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal, Madhuri Dixit Nene, and designer Manish Malhotra. Pictures and videos from the event went viral, and Madhuri Dixit shared some photos on Instagram, expressing her enjoyment at the party. The pictures showed Ananya and Aditya posing with Katrina and Vicky, Madhuri with Karan Johar, and Madhuri with Kiara Advani, Sidharth Malhotra, Sanjay Kapoor, and Bhumi Pednekar. Ananya and Aditya have been rumored to be dating since last year when they appeared together at another Diwali party, but neither has confirmed the reports. They also recently visited the Maldives to celebrate Ananya's 25th birthday.

item.title: Kerala farmer ends life allegedly due to financial crisis; Governor, opposition criticise govt
item.description: A farmer in Alappuzha district, Kerala, allegedly died by suicide due to financial problems related to unpaid paddy procurement. The farmer, K G Prasad, left a suicide note blaming the state government and some banks for his extreme step. This incident has sparked a political controversy in Kerala. The opposition party leader, V D Satheesan, criticized the government for its failure in paddy procurement and delayed payments to farmers. While the police are yet to confirm the exact reason behind the farmer's suicide, friends and other farmers claim that Prasad took his own life because he didn't receive payment from the government for the paddy he had procured. The farmer's alleged suicide note accused the government and banks of being responsible for his death. A video call made by Prasad before his death was also broadcasted, where he expressed his frustration over banks denying him a loan due to a low credit score. Farmers have expressed grievances over the government's handling of the situation and lack of support for their financial struggles. Governor Arif Muhammed Khan expressed his condolences to Prasad's family and acknowledged the crisis faced by farmers in the state. The opposition parties, Congress and BJP, blamed the ruling Left Democratic Front (LDF) government for neglecting farmers' issues. The state government defended itself, stating that PRS arrears were not the reason for the farmer's suicide, and money had been paid for the rice procured from farmers.

item.title: Pakistan: Yet another senior leader from Imran Khan’s party resigns
item.description: A former secretary general of Imran Khan's party, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), has resigned from the party's basic membership. Asad Umar stated that he disagreed with the policy of confrontation with state institutions and believed it was not in the country's interest. Umar joins a list of senior party leaders who have left politics after the violent protests on May 9, following Imran Khan's arrest on corruption charges. Umar had been arrested but released on bail after promising not to participate in violent protests. Several party leaders have also deserted Khan and his party, forming factions with similar names. The PTI has experienced a decline in popularity since the events of May 9, with leaders often going through a pattern of arrest, condemnation of violence, and resignation from the party or politics altogether.

item.title: Iceland evacuates people amid volcanic threat, declares state of emergency
item.description: Iceland has declared a state of emergency due to an increased risk of a volcanic eruption in the coastal town of Grindavik. The authorities have urged residents to evacuate calmly as a precautionary measure. The Icelandic Meteorological Office has recorded nearly 800 earthquakes in the southwest of the country, indicating the possibility of an eruption. However, there are currently no signs that the magma is nearing the surface. The situation is being closely monitored, and residents have been advised to follow the instructions of Icelandic authorities. The Blue Lagoon thermal pool in the affected area has already closed due to the ongoing seismic activity. Iceland, known for its tectonic plate boundary, is home to 32 active volcanoes.

item.title: Demonetisation ‘biggest corruption’ in world: Akhilesh Yadav
item.description: Samajwadi Party Chief Akhilesh Yadav criticized demonetization by calling it the "biggest corruption" in the world. He accused the BJP government of using demonetization as a strategy to compensate for the country's loss of Rs 15 lakh crore, stating that the decision benefited the rich at the expense of the poor. Yadav also highlighted that corruption, inflation, and unemployment continue to plague the country despite the government's claims that demonetization would address these issues. Furthermore, he expressed support for women employees working in the dial 112 response system and criticized the BJP government for not fulfilling its promise to increase their salaries. Yadav also criticized the BJP for ruining the dial 100 police service and accused it of promoting corruption in every police station. He mentioned an incident in Deoria and expressed dissatisfaction with the Agniveer scheme, promising to end it and provide full employment in the army. The article also mentioned the celebration of a baby called "Khajanchi," whose birth during demonetization Yadav used to criticize the BJP.

item.title: UP: Illegal firecrackers worth over Rs 15 lakhs seized, 2 held
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Two individuals, Santosh Yadav and Ankur Baranwal, attempted to flee but were captured by the police. The raid recovered a large quantity of illegal firecrackers stored in sacks. The duo had been involved in the unauthorized sale of firecrackers for several years without a license. An FIR has been registered against them.

item.title: One lamp can light up many others; share joys with poor, needy: Prez Murmu on Diwali eve
item.description: President Droupadi Murmu greeted citizens on the eve of Diwali and emphasized the importance of sharing happiness and prosperity with the poor and needy. She described Diwali as a festival of joy, symbolizing the victory of light over darkness, good over evil, and justice over injustice. Murmu highlighted that people of different religions and faiths celebrate this festival, spreading love, brotherhood, and harmony. She expressed that Diwali illuminates our conscience and inspires us to work for the welfare of humanity. Murmu urged everyone to celebrate the festival safely and contribute to environmental conservation for nation-building. In her message, she extended warm greetings and best wishes to all fellow citizens in India and abroad.

item.title: Human rights group accuses Pakistan of using Afghan refugees as ‘political pawns’
item.description: Amnesty International has called on the Government of Pakistan to stop the detention, deportation, and alleged harassment of Afghan refugees. The human rights group expressed concern for the safety of Afghan refugees returning to Taliban-ruled Afghanistan, citing reports of harassment in holding centers and instances where legal migrants with proper documentation were targeted. Amnesty warned that continued deportations would deny at-risk Afghans, especially women and girls, access to safety, education, and livelihood. The international community has been reluctant to recognize the Taliban-led government in Afghanistan due to allegations of human rights violations. Pakistan has linked the increase in terrorist incidents to the Taliban's return to power and their failure to take action against militants using Afghan soil for attacks in Pakistan. The Doha Accord, which facilitated the US exit from Afghanistan, included assurances from the Taliban that Afghan soil would not be used for terrorism against any country, including Pakistan.

item.title: South African cricketer Keshav Maharaj extends support to World Hindu Congress
item.description: South African cricketer Keshav Maharaj has expressed his support for the upcoming three-day World Hindu Congress (WHC)-2023, which will be taking place in Bangkok from November 24. Despite his inability to attend due to World Cup commitments, Maharaj extended his best wishes to the event and hoped it would be a successful gathering. The WHC-2023, organized by the World Hindu Foundation, is expected to host delegates from over 60 countries. This conference includes various parallel conferences, such as the Hindu Youth Conference, which aims to empower young Hindu leaders and promote positive change. Prominent figures like RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath are scheduled to address the WHC-2023.

item.title: Diwali 2023: A look at popular Hindi cinema scenes depicting festival of lights
item.description: This article highlights five popular scenes from Hindi cinema that have incorporated the festival of Diwali into their narratives. The first scene is from the movie "Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham" (2001), where Jaya Bachchan's character senses the arrival of her son Rahul, played by Shah Rukh Khan, on Diwali. The second scene is from the film "Vaastav" (1999), featuring Sanjay Dutt's character coming out of his hide-out to meet his family during Diwali. In the movie "Zanjeer" (1973), the festival plays an important part as the protagonist, played by Amitabh Bachchan, seeks justice for his parents' murder on Diwali. The popular track "Dhik Tana" in "Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!" (1994) also includes a brief scene set during Diwali, capturing the essence of the festival and celebrating togetherness. Lastly, the film "Chachi 420" (1997) showcases a pivotal scene emphasizing the importance of safety during Diwali, where Kamal Haasan's character saves his daughter from a firecracker mishap.

item.title: To check air pollution, Bihar to ‘name and shame’ farmers who burn crop residue
item.description: The Bihar government plans to publicly name and shame farmers who burn crop residue, in an effort to combat rising air pollution. The names of such farmers will be displayed at block offices, and action will be taken against them under relevant laws. The state government has banned crop residue burning to protect soil fertility and issued a warning that financial assistance and subsidies will be denied to those who practice it. The decisions were made during a meeting chaired by the Chief Secretary, with the aim of discouraging farmers from harming the environment. The government has also conducted awareness campaigns and provided subsidies for farm equipment. The issue of poor air quality, particularly during winter, has been a concern in several cities in Bihar. In April, numerous farmers were penalized for violating norms related to crop residue burning.

item.title: 80 Indian fishermen released by Pak govt handed over to BSF at Wagah border
item.description: Eighty Indian fishermen who were recently released from a jail in Pakistan have been handed over to BSF authorities at the Attari-Wagah border. The prisoners crossed over to India on Friday night through the land transit route of the Attari-Wagah border. The fishermen were held three years ago after their boats slipped into Pakistan through territorial waters in the Arabian Sea. Fishermen are frequently arrested along with their boats by both India and Pakistan due to the poorly defined maritime border in the Arabian Sea.

item.title: Allu Arjun mourns demise of Telugu actor Chandra Mohan
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Telugu actor Chandra Mohan has passed away at the age of 82 after suffering a cardiac arrest at a hospital in Hyderabad. Chandra Mohan was known for his work in Telugu films and had received several awards for his performances. The final farewell and last rites are set to take place in Hyderabad on November 13.

item.title: Pakistan leader Asad Umar quits Imran Khan’s party, quits politics
item.description: Asad Umar, the former secretary general of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), has announced his resignation from the party's basic membership and his decision to quit politics altogether. Umar, who was a close aide of PTI Chairman Imran Khan, cited his disagreement with the party's policy of confrontation with state institutions as the reason for his resignation. This comes after a nationwide crackdown on the PTI and the arrest of several party leaders following riots on May 9. Umar thanked his supporters and expressed his desire for Allah's blessings upon Pakistan.

item.title: Israel-Hamas war: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi arrives in Saudi Arabia to attend OIC Summit
item.description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi arrived in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, to attend the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) summit, which aimed to discuss the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas. Raisi was seen wearing a traditional Palestinian keffiyeh scarf and greeted Saudi officials upon his arrival. Other leaders attending the summit include Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, the President of Libya’s Presidential Council Mohamed Al-Manfi, Pakistan’s caretaker prime minister Anwarul Haq Kakar, and Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim. The Iranian Foreign Ministry sent a team of experts to assess a document on the Gaza crisis that will be released at the summit. Earlier, Raisi and Erdogan held talks on the Gaza crisis during the 16th Summit of the Economic Cooperation Organisation. They emphasized the need to halt Israeli bombardment in Gaza and expressed concern over the crimes committed by Israel against Palestinians. Iran's Foreign Minister also wrote letters to BRICS countries urging them to intervene and stop the attacks in Gaza.

item.title: Ram Charan- Kiara Advani’s ‘Game Changer’ first single ‘Jaragandi’ release date pushed
item.description: The release date for the first track of the upcoming film "Game Changer," starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, has been postponed due to audio documentation issues between different firms. The makers of the film issued a statement on X (formerly Twitter) announcing the delay and assuring fans that the wait will be worth it. The song was originally scheduled to be released on Diwali 2023. The film, directed by Shankar, is an action drama with current-day politics and will be released in Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi languages. The official release date for the film is still unknown.

item.title: Equity 360 facilitates Bharat Housing Network with 125 Crores in Series A Funding
item.description:
Bharat Housing Network, a technology platform for co-lending in affordable housing, has raised INR 125 crores in funding. The investment was led by NABVENTURES Fund, with participation from other investors such as Varanium NexGen Fund, 9Unicorns, Riverwalk Holdings, SMK Ventures, DMI Sparkle Fund, LC Nueva, and more. This is the seventh investment announced by NABVENTURES Fund in 2023.
Bharat Housing Network is India's largest co-lending infrastructure for credit delivery in the affordable mortgages-priority sector. The platform provides capital, technology, and infrastructure to housing finance companies and non-banking finance companies. It operates on a hybrid capital model for growth and scale.
The demand for housing finance in India is expected to grow significantly due to the country's growing population, rising household incomes, and declining average household size. The industry is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 13-14% in the long run, with home loan originations reaching INR 10.4 trillion by FY25 and INR 18.7 trillion by FY30. The co-lending platform aims to address this demand, with a focus on the <INR 2.5 million ticket size category.
The platform's integrated technology stack offers a complete co-lending solution to lenders in the affordable housing finance segment. It has onboarded 23 financial institutions and leverages partner branch networks across 12 states. Since its inception in 2021, the platform has achieved significant growth while maintaining high asset quality.
Bharat Housing Network is enabling financial inclusion by providing credit to semi-urban and rural areas. It focuses on delivering housing credit to low-income and economically weaker sections of society, contributing to 13 UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
The investment by NABVENTURES Fund aligns with the government's initiatives, such as PM Awaas Yojana, to encourage low-cost housing and affordable loans. The CEO of NABVENTURES Fund highlighted the importance of affordable housing and their intention to invest in at least nine startups by the year-end.
The founder of Equity 360 expressed confidence in Bharat Housing Network's ability to contribute to the "Housing for All" vision of New India. The platform aims to make housing credit more accessible and affordable across income groups.
Please note that this summary is generated by an AI model and may not be completely accurate.

item.title: Exclusive-UAE plans to maintain ties with Israel despite Gaza outcry, sources say
item.description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) plans to maintain its diplomatic ties with Israel despite the international outcry over the war in Gaza. The UAE aims to have a moderating influence on Israel's campaign while safeguarding its own interests, according to sources familiar with UAE government policy. Abu Dhabi became the most prominent Arab nation to establish diplomatic ties with Israel in 30 years under the U.S.-brokered Abraham Accords in 2020. The mounting death toll in Gaza has stirred outrage in Arab capitals, but the UAE has publicly condemned Israel's actions and called for an end to the violence. The UAE is also working to moderate the public positions of other Arab states to facilitate a return to dialogue once the war ends. The UAE continues to host an Israeli ambassador and has no plans to sever diplomatic ties. The UAE's motivation for establishing ties with Israel includes shared concerns over Iran and economic-driven realignment of foreign policy. Despite their close ties, Abu Dhabi has been concerned about Israel's right-wing government's expansion of Jewish settlements in the West Bank and visits to the Al Aqsa mosque compound. The displacement of Palestinians from Gaza or the West Bank into Egypt or Jordan is seen as a red line for Abu Dhabi. The UAE has distanced itself from Hamas, viewing them as a threat to regional stability. They have played a significant role in opposing the Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt and Sudan.

item.title: Japan-led navy exercise starts with Philippines observing for first time
item.description: Japan has started a joint annual military exercise called Annualex, with the Philippines observing the operations for the first time. The exercise involves the naval forces of the United States, Australia, and Canada, with the Philippines attending as an observer. The goal is to seek closer maritime cooperation between Japan and the Philippines. The exercise is not being conducted to target a specific country, but rather to enhance security cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region. The operations will last for 10 days and involve 30 ships and 40 aircraft. This comes as Japan, the US, and the Philippines aim to strengthen ties and deepen security cooperation to counter China. Last week, Japan announced it would provide radar systems to the Philippines, and the two countries also started negotiations for a reciprocal military access agreement.

item.title: Mexico’s Acapulco hit by garbage pile-up after deadly hurricane
item.description: Residents of Acapulco are facing an additional issue following Hurricane Otis: piles of garbage in the streets. The hurricane, which struck on October 25th, caused major flooding and destroyed many homes in the city. As a result, furnishings, bedding, and household appliances are being discarded outside homes along with bags of rotting organic waste, causing foul odors and concerns about disease. The government has deployed troops to help clean up the city, but the rubbish is accumulating rapidly. Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has stated that clearing up Acapulco is a top priority and measures are being taken to prevent disease. However, experts warn that if waste blocks drainage and contaminates the water supply, there is a risk of mosquito-borne illnesses such as dengue and yellow fever outbreaks.

item.title: J’khand: Teachers ghearo JMM office demanding pay fixation
item.description: Hundreds of teachers in Jharkhand gheraoed the central office of the ruling JMM in Ranchi, demanding pay fixation. These teachers, who have qualified the Jharkhand Teacher's Eligibility Test (JTET), claim that their pay scales have not been fixed despite passing the examination. They have been staging a demonstration near Raj Bhavan for the past 81 days. They threatened to intensify the protest if their demands were not considered appropriately. The government had recommended providing a pay scale to the teachers during a high-level meeting in June 2020. JMM Central General Secretary Vinod Kumar Pandey has assured the teachers that their demand will be taken to the government.

item.title: Falguni Shah, the singer who took Modi’s millet song to Grammys grew up on RD Burman, Beatles
item.description: Indian-American singer-songwriter couple Falguni and Gaurav Shah have gained recognition at the Grammys with their song "The Abundance in Millets" featuring Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The song, which promotes food security, includes a portion of Modi's speech at the Global Millets Conference. Falguni and Gaurav are established in the international music scene, having worked with A.R. Rahman and Yo Yo Ma. Falguni has performed at prestigious venues and collaborated with artists like Ricky Martin and Wyclef Jean. Last year, her album "A Colorful World" won a Grammy for Best Children's Album. This year's nomination is a surprise for the Shahs, who expressed gratitude to PM Modi for his involvement. The article also mentions other notable Indian Grammy winners and nominees, as well as the public's reactions to Modi's nomination. Overall, it highlights the significance of this nomination in promoting India's indigenous crop and the pride associated with it.

item.title: Rajasthan Mahila Kalyan Mandal Wins Special Jury Award for Martha Farrell Award for Gender Equality
item.description: The Rajasthan Mahila Kalyan Mandal (RMKM), a non-profit organization, has been awarded the Martha Farrell Award for Gender Equality. RMKM focuses on empowering underprivileged women in Rajasthan and promoting gender equality in the region. The organization addresses the challenges faced by women in rural areas, including limited access to resources and employment opportunities. Their programs include inclusive education, health education, capacity-building, and microcredit initiatives. Notable initiatives include the "gift-a-goat program" to provide sustainable income and nutrition, and the "livelihood enhancement through self-help groups" program, which has benefited thousands of marginalized women. RMKM's work aims to challenge social practices and traditions to create a more equitable society. The organization is grateful for the recognition and remains committed to its efforts in promoting gender equality and inclusivity.

item.title: Vigilance Minister initiates inquiry against Delhi chief secy in Bamnoli land acquisition case
item.description: Delhi Vigilance Minister Atishi has initiated an inquiry into a complaint against Chief Secretary Naresh Kumar. The complaint alleges that the chief secretary's son was employed by a relative of a landowner who received enhanced compensation for land acquired for a road project. Atishi has directed the divisional commissioner and vigilance director to provide all the files related to the land acquisition. The chief secretary claims that the complaint is an act of "mudslinging" by disgruntled individuals facing vigilance investigations. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has requested a detailed report on the matter. The complaint involves the acquisition of land in Bamnoli village for the Dwarka Expressway. The District Magistrate and the Additional District Magistrate had differing valuations for the land, resulting in a significant increase in compensation. Hemant Kumar, who awarded the increased compensation, was suspended by the Ministry of Home Affairs and a CBI probe was ordered. The involvement of the chief secretary is now being examined.

item.title: Major terror bid foiled in Pakistan’s Punjab province; 5 TTP, LeJ terrorists arrested
item.description: Pakistani counter-terrorism officials have claimed to have foiled a major terror plot targeting key installations in Punjab province. The Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) of the Punjab police conducted 179 intelligence-based operations across various districts, resulting in the arrest of five suspected terrorists from banned outfits. The arrested individuals were linked to the Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Jhangvi (LeJ) militant groups. The militants had planned sabotage across the province and aimed to target important installations. During the operations, half a kg of explosives, two hand grenades, two IED bombs, detonators, safety fuse wire, prima cards, and banned literature were recovered. The suspects have been registered under five cases and taken to an undisclosed location for interrogation.

item.title: Will take over Sena ‘shakhas’ where illegal activities are being carried out, says Shinde faction leader
item.description: The Shiv Sena party, led by Eknath Shinde, has announced its intention to take control of all former branches, known as 'shakhas,' that have been engaged in inappropriate activities. The party recently took over and demolished a shakha in Mumbra, which led to tensions with members of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena. Thackeray is expected to visit the area later in the day under police protection to prevent any potential fallout from this issue. Naresh Mhaske, a member of the Shiv Sena, claimed that Thackeray's visit was influenced by NCP leader Jitendra Awhad, pointing out that posters welcoming Thackeray did not feature images of Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray or Anand Dighe.

item.title: Raigad pharma factory fire: Victims’ bodies handed over to kin after DNA test
item.description: The bodies of 11 individuals who died in a recent factory fire in Maharashtra's Raigad district have been handed over to their families. The victims' identities were determined through DNA tests due to the severe charring of the bodies. The pharmaceutical company, Blue Jet Healthcare, has declared a payout of Rs 30 lakh for each victim's family. The bodies were given to the families on Friday and taken to their respective hometowns for final rites. The fire, which occurred on November 3 at the company's plant in Mahad MIDC, resulted in 11 fatalities and seven injuries. An initial investigation indicated that an electric short circuit was the cause. A senior official from the pharmaceutical company has been booked for alleged culpable homicide. One employee responsible for plant maintenance has been arrested, while two others have been named in the case. The incident has led to a complaint being filed under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code.

The accused individuals were recruited and indoctrinated by a Canada-based terrorist, and they were involved in recruiting youngsters, smuggling arms and explosives, and carrying out extortion for terrorist activities. The investigation has also revealed the systematic channeling of extortion funds to foreign countries to fuel terrorist activities in India. item.title: Veena Developers Announces Multi-Million Investment in High-End Mumbai Projects
item.description: Veena Developers, a prominent real estate firm in Mumbai, has announced plans for three high-end real estate projects in the city. The projects will be located in Kandivali, Borivali, and Andheri, with a total sale area of 1.4 million square feet and a construction area of nearly 4 million square feet. The company expects these projects to generate revenue of approximately Rs 3500 crore. Veena Developers aims to provide sophisticated and comfortable living spaces that cater to the luxury and semi-luxury segments. They plan to allocate 80% of the projects to luxury residential spaces and the remaining 20% to high-end retail spaces. The company is set to complete these developments before 2027. In addition to the upcoming projects, Veena Developers is also delivering five million square feet across various ongoing projects. The Chairman of Veena Developers, Haresh Sanghavi, highlighted their focus on offering exclusive living experiences that depict elegance. The company has a strong presence in key areas of Mumbai, including Kandivali, Andheri, Malad, Chembur, and Santacruz, with a diverse portfolio of luxury and semi-luxury residential developments. They are also involved in commercial projects in Malad-West and affordable housing options in Palghar. Veena Developers has observed a surge in interest, particularly in their luxury offerings, indicating a growing demand for premium residential spaces. They have also noticed a shift in preferences among millennials, with increasing demand from women homebuyers. This reflects an inclusive societal trend and emphasizes the importance of catering to diverse homeowner preferences.

item.title: Study gives more insight into bacterium’s protective role in chronic rhinosinusitis
item.description:
The prevalence of chronic rhinosinusitis (CRS) has been increasing in Japan and around the world. CRS is an inflammatory condition that causes symptoms like nasal congestion, discharge, trouble breathing, face pain, and loss of smell. Treating CRS is challenging because it presents in various ways. There are two categories: eosinophilic (ECRS) and non-eosinophilic (non-ECRS) CRS. ECRS is associated with higher levels of eosinophils, a type of white blood cell that releases pro-inflammatory substances, in the nasal and sinus tissues.
The rise in CRS is influenced by environmental factors, which in turn are affected by lifestyle changes. The role of the nasal microbiome in the development of ECRS has not been clear. To address this, a research team from the University of Fukui conducted a study on CRS in a Japanese population, specifically focusing on the nasal microbiome. They collected nasal swabs from 143 subjects, including those with ECRS, non-ECRS, and healthy controls.
The researchers found significant differences in the microbiome diversity between the CRS and control groups, indicating the involvement of the nasal microbiome in the disease. Additionally, they observed distinct microbiome compositions between the ECRS and non-ECRS groups. The bacterium Fusobacterium nucleatum (F nucleatum) was found to be less abundant in patients with ECRS. Metagenomic analyses showed that lipopolysaccharide (LPS) synthesis was greater in patients with non-ECRS compared to ECRS.
Based on these findings, the researchers speculated that LPS produced by F nucleatum may be linked to the pathogenesis of both ECRS and non-ECRS. Further experiments demonstrated that LPS derived from F nucleatum suppressed the expression of ALOX15, an enzyme involved in nasal polyps and eosinophil-related inflammation.
The study concludes that disruptions in the nasal microbiome likely play a crucial role in ECRS. Understanding this could lead to the development of more effective strategies for treating CRS. The researchers believe that the microbiome may also have an impact on other allergic diseases and suggest future studies for probiotic development and lifestyle modifications to prevent chronic sinusitis.
